There's all kinds of national and world news too. We already had Netflix and Amazon Prime anyway, and with the Roku, we added CBS All Access. We lucked out because pretty much every show we watch is on CBS, and for $9.99/month we can watch any show we want, any time we want, commercial-free. There are so many channels and options! I just wish we'd done it sooner.

I have this unit literally 10 feet from a modern, high speed router operating at both 2 and 5 GHz and a fiber optic connection to the internet. Wireless at my house screams for every device except for one; this Roku. I constantly get warnings about a slow connection. I'm at wit's end; I've gone into the 'secret' menu and disabled/enabled network ping. I've moved it up, down, around the room. Doesn't matter. Slow connection to the internet; yet every other device I test gets between 80-90 Mbps. So wishing I had purchased one with an Ethernet port. Maybe it would help if this thing had an external antenna connection, I don't know.
Worked perfectly right out of the box.  Setup instructions very clear, easy to follow.  Took, maybe, 5 mins most of that time was entering id's and passwords for my Netflix and other services.

It seem Roku is incapable of actually providing service to all of the new customers the pandemic brought them. First problem: you must create a Roku account to use the device, but their website isn't working, customer service is off duty until the pandemic is over, and their online community is full of people having the same problems we are: Fill in the Create An Account screen, hit continue, data disappears. Try 6 different versions of your name, etc. AND STILL WON'T ALLOW YOU TO CREATE AN ACCOUNT. Based on their community pages, hundreds, if not thousands, are having the same problem.There's also the issue of their date collection practices: basically, according to the policy you must consent to, they will collect every bit of data transmitted over your wife, including from all your devices - phone, computers, anything on wifi - and sort it, track it and sell it.

I learned this today. If you already own a Roku and you're on a "basic" plan, whatever that is, if you buy another Roku before you can activate it you have to pay $100 for 3 years of premium service or $149 for a lifetime premium service. I am returning this and will buy a firestick.New Roku will fail to activate, telling you to call support.  When I called they said they would upgrade my account to premium.  When I asked if there was a charge, i was told the price.  When I said that I didn't want to do it, I was told that it was already done.  I was mad that I was tricked into extra charges.

Great--works perfect and didn't take long for a tech novice like me to set up.  I, however, almost got taken for the one time activation fee, but only knew not to do it because of reading a review on amazon beforehand.  I had gone to the website exactly as shown in the pamphlet that came with the product and got a pop up with a chat saying this service rep wanted to help me get set up--ok sure, until he mentioned the activation fee!  Quickly I said no and "x-ed" out of the conversation.  Do not be fooled by these scammers--product does NOT require "one-time activation fee" to work!

Okay so let me start by saying the TV that this is being hooked up to is a 1080p it is an old television that was never used except for gaming in my son's room. I did not feel like spending the extra money for a extra cable box in his room so I decided to buy this and it has turned out as an excellent option with this he now has a working television in his room we use it to stream Netflix Amazon prime and there are various other free options that come with it. There may be better options out there but for the money this seems to work perfect no lag no issues so far

I had initial problems setting this thing up. When trying to connect to a Frontier FIOS router it refused to connect showing an incorrect password.  I enable guest wi-fi on the router and it did connect using the guest wi-fi password. Subsequently it updated its firmware. After that it did connect to my router in standard mode.  As others have said it is 2.4 GHz only.  I did not like the fact Roku needs a credit card to register online. I already have Netflix and Amazon Prime, both paid services and have no intention of adding more. I don't like having a credit card on file when it is not going to ever be used. That is just a data breach target. No thanks! There are workarounds you can find on the internet that utilize PayPal, so you don't have to use a credit card. It took me a awhile to realize the up arrow means capital letters on the password interface. In Windows that means go up on the file tree. Yet, if you go to other password interfaces for the paid services clicking the "abc" button capitalizes the letters.  The unit does work well with quite a bit of free TV options. Amazon dropped support of Prime on my Sony TV and that is why I got this unit.

I am a HUGE amazon product fan.  I think their "fire" products are very affordable.  I have multi firesticks/boxes in my home. Having 2 kids, we watch  Disney+ a lot!For some reason on my fireTV products my app is very slow.  Yes it is watchable, but the loading and even fast forwarding was just not as instant as I wanted it to be.  I did end up purchasing the firetv box just to hard wire it in one room (in case I was having wifi issues).  Disney+ on my Xbox etc worked fine, but every firetv product I have its SLOW.  Just got this roku and been having movie night with the kids and it is FAST!  Menus load (with pics right away).  Even titles with tons of seasons (think Mickeyhouse club house).  So just that alone makes this a great purchase.

still one of the best streaming devices ive ever bought. Best bang for your buck. easy to set up works great and has everything i need for streaming basic services. The only negative and its not really that big of a deal is that if im standing too close to the IR sensor and not aiming directly at it the remote has a hard time making the connection at anything less than 6 feet. luckily ive learned lately that social distancing can make things so much better and by just stepping back a few more feet the problem is solved.

I really love the roku but it seems to have so many glitches. For awhile we couldn't get any videos to play on YouTube. Then the ads on Hulu cut parts of the show out and you cant rewind to view them. (It doesnt do this on our tablets or phones, only roku).Now amazon prime TV wont open at all. I've restarted it, deleted channels, tried updates,etc etc. I still seem to keep having glitches. After a couple months the YouTube problem resolved, not sure how. But hulu and amazon prime apps are still having issues.

Sooooo excited to have this!!!I just moved away from home and, admittedly, never had to worry about TV channels (I always just got on Netflix on my laptop anyways). But now that I’m on my own, I realized I now have a TV and A) had no idea how to stream to it and B) was getting tired of watching Netflix ALL the time but wasn’t ready to pay for cable. I know I’m extremely late in the game but I just didn’t realize just how many options are available to you with Roku!! (Maybe others as well? Not sure) so many free channels, but even if you want to pay for others it’s still so much cheaper than paying for cable alone

I bought this product and entered my code that came from the TV.  A message came that I would have to complete the order by calling a specific number.  I called and the person on the other end asked for $80.00 via my credit card telling me I would be able to use it on any TV in the home.  I was so frustrated that I hung up.  Then I noticed at the bottom of the page on the TV was a message that said, "we will never ask for money to activate".  So I looked up the number for Roku and told the person assisting me and he said that was a scam that is going around.  So please be beware.

RETURNING ITEMS! Not HD with it's poor picture quality; basic, limited, & quite useless remote which makes multiple remotes necessary. You cannot power the TV on/off, control the volume, nor access options easily with this remote. Can't pause live TV through this device either. This technology performs as if it were manufactured in 1998, NOT 2018.I bought this device (2 actually) to save $ on my Xfinity cable bill. Per Xfinity customer service rep, I could use a Roku device to stream Xfinity in lieu of leasing their standard receivers for $10/mo + taxes each. The poor, pre-plasma/LED/HD picture quality on my 1080p HD TV, toggling between remotes, and jumping all over the place to get to 1 app is purely frustrating. I will continue to pay $20+ per month for my Xfinity receivers.

We bought this for our kitchen TV as a large cable box is not an option.  Previously, using a very small cable box, we could receive about 100 channels.  Navigation was easy.  We could turn on the TV with one remote and get the channel we were last at.  If we wanted to switch from channel 4, for example, to channel 68, we picked up the room and entered “68” and we were there.With Roku, turning on the TV now requires two remotes, not one.  And navigating simply to the news is 8 steps.  While we now get 1,000 channels, if we want to watch HBO through our Spectrum subscription, that requires 8 steps and scrolling through 500 channels.  And, for sure, there will be buffering issues.  And if you are watching the same show as someone in the next room, there can be a minute or so difference.

I bought this to put on a third TV. I bought a ROKU TV and liked it so much I purchased a ROKU for another TV I had. I liked them both so much I purchased this one for my third. I enjoy the free stations that have a lot of older programs on that I enjoy. It's easy to use. My streaming is very good as well. I am hoping ROKU stays in business. I will purchase ROKU TV's from now on if they are available. Most of their add on devices are very good. I would always want to purchase their later models they are always improving.

This is a very easy to use streaming device. Streaming services can be loaded from the Roku app so you only see what you need (in my case Netflix/Prime video/YouTube) and avoid all unwanted apps usually seen on a smart TV. A great upgrade for a nonsmart TV or an outdated smart TV (I bought 3 already @24.00 each). The only inconvenience is the remote that only has Roku functions, no tv power/channel/volume/source. But there's a 14 dll programmable remote here on Amazon that adds exactly those buttons while keeping the Roku functions untouched. I don't care about picture quality HD 4K 8K and all that crap...

I had read in another review that an HDMI splitter would need to be HDCP compatible to work with this Roku.  My splitter is HDCP compatible, but still, it did not work with my splitter.  As a matter of fact, for whatever reason, it would not work in my living room, even when plugged in independently in the HDMI port on the television, possibly because I used the existing HDMI cable (Hi-Def cable, at that).  I finally gave up in exasperation and moved the new unit to the bedroom, and put the older Roku LT unit in the living room.  They both work just fine now.  I guess I'm good until Roku stops supporting the Roku LT, but I'll cross that bridge when I come to it.  Me mindful of your setup when you order this unit.  The HDMI cable provided, which may be a necessity to get this unit to work as it should,  is extremely short!

If your "smart" TV has WiFi problems like both my Sony and LG TV's do, the Roku Express will likely solve those problems. I'm not saying it's perfect for everyone, as one reviewer who gave it 1 star angrily (albeit correctly) noted, it "does not offer a native web browser to surf the internet...game over." But another complaint I read that might be taken seriously (as it could actually be an issue in some instances) is that it only supports WiFi transmission up to 2.4 GHz. To be sure, if all things were equal, something like the Firestick (which also supports 5.0) might be the better choice, but since the Roku Express is currently $10 cheaper, and 2.4 is perfect for my needs, I'm personally happy with the Roku Express.

I was happy that this unit pulled over my selected channels from my old Roku stick that died. I did not like all the pre-loaded channels that Roku put on there automatically.  If I wanted hulu, sling, Netflix, ESPN, or mlb to name a few I could have selected them myself during setup. Unless I subscribe, why would I want them in my channel lineup?  The option to plug into the tv instead of the power outlet is really nice. I will miss the no miss no fuss of the stick.  I had to finagle the little box a bit to wedge it where it would stay pointed frontward. The cords kept trying to pull it off to the side and I refuse to add tape too that will eventually become a dust magnet when this unit dies.  Overall, picture is very clear.  Sound started out alarmingly loud, but I was able to adjust it.  My old stick initiated faster and I'm not crazy about the format.

I don’t know why anyone would bother trying anything else because ROKU makes a product that works well and works easily and simply right out of the box!  No complicated setup, etc. This is my third ROKU.  I have had the other 2 for several years.  I even take them with me when I travel.  Only problem with them is that I had to buy new remotes because I keep dropping them and the battery cover breaks.  This newer version has a lighter and smaller streaming box (not sure that matters much unless you want to glue it to a wall/TV).  The remote is also slimmer and lighter, but still works basically the same way.  One of my TVs is a smart TV, but since I use all 3, it is easier to have the same interface on all 3 for me.

I am not too educated when it comes to all these new devices used for streaming. I still use a DVD player, to give you a better example.I do have an Amazon streaming device on another TV, but I feel like I am essentially attached to Amazon using it. I was pleasantly surprised that the Roku is just a free streaming device.

The main reason that I purchased this us to stream the xfinity app which isn't available on most platforms. One week in and it has worked well. The remote is very simple to use, but it does still use IR technology and doesn't have a speech recognition feature like some of the newer versions.

Love!! We have Samsung smart TVs all through the house, but they don’t support Disney+, PBS kids, or CBS apps so we were always having to hook up the iPad for these things. Finally caved and I love the roku. I don’t have to wait for the tv to “warm up” anymore before accessing the apps and it’s so smooth and easy to navigate. Wish I hadn’t bothered with smart TVs and just jumped to this. Well worth $25.Some cons though: There isn’t any volume control on this remote so you still have to use your regular tv remote. Also, the buttons on the remote are for specific apps which I guess is good if you have those, but wish they were customizable. Finally, the sticky thing to attach the little box to your tv doesn’t really work if it’s hanging underneath. It was fine when it was attached to the base and didn’t have gravity working against it.

It has some nice features. But closed captioning on Prime Video no longer works, and you cannot see star ratings or give them on Netflix. The loss of the Prime button is annoying, but that is Amazon's problem, not ROKU's. But the loss of closed captioning is disgusting. It only works during replay. So if you use the goback button, you get a few seconds of captions, then they shut off again. They work fine on Netflix, so I know I have the setting correct. And the new "user interface" for Netflix is awful. Instead of seeing that a movie has 3 stars, it just starts playing the movie for you. YUK. And you can only give it a thumbs up or a thumbs down after watching. All in all, not a pleasant experience. Keep your old ROKU as long as you can.

Roku, as a basic idea is great but the problem comes later on.If you are an American traditional family then Roku will cover all your basic needs. Now, if your family is made from a mix of America & Spain then you will have troubles.

I have gone through the pairing set-up with Amazon tech support - no way to get in touch with a Roku tech support person - but was not able to get my Amazon Echo (Alexa) to communicate with my Roku Express (Model 3930R). We tried everything and all phrasing suggested. Both are on the same wifi (2.4 Ghz) at close range with no interference. The linking was confirmed on both Amazon Echo and Alexa App. I wonder whether it is really possible to work this Roku model with Alexa, as advertised. The Roku platform works fine, but not through Alexa voice command.

Am still exploring. I was a little disappointed that LinkedIn Learning doesn't support Roku anymore but that's OK, I have my iPad for that. Their loss.Still, I'm very pleased with the Channels I've gotten. It does depend on your Cable/FIOS provider...I still have the triple play under Verizon as this is a test.

Roku is in line with many of the competitor streaming devices. The one thing that Roku has over the other devices is the ability to access my cable companies streaming app through the device. It saves me the cost of one of my cable boxes! I’m always down for saving money.I will admit, sometimes the picture is a bit pixelated (even with 1080p and above average internet). Eventually the picture does sharpen.  Granted, I did buy the cheapest model. The picture quality may be better on the more expensive devices. Overall, I would definitely recommend. I may even by a second one for a different bedroom.

All on my ROKU. Between sling, prime, Apple, Hulu and Netflix I pay less than 30% of what was my cable provide bill. But of coarse the cable provider jack the price up so they get their share. Morons that they are will loss my business as soon as I can replace them too. On another issue while not naming the cable company they Deliberately Interrupt the bandwidth used by my devices such as Firestick, AppleTV, GoogleTV, ROKU and others I use. Which causes delays, freezing and signal loss all the time. But if you use their Cable or online services it never happens. ROKU is one that has less issues and is more dependable that anyone else’s systems. I have worked with thousands of different streaming devices this is cheap and It’s not the best but it works.

El equipo, funciona correctamente, pero explico lo siguiente, la interfaz del mismo es mucho inferior al "fire tv de Amazon", de hecho tengo un fire tv desde hace 2 años y medio y comenzó a fallarme ahora, por eso decidí  cambiarlo. Este nuevo que adquirí, solo tienes algunas aplicaciones que puedes descargar y poder utilizarlo, lo demás todo es por paga, tienes que poner un tarjeta de crédito. El control funciona muy bien, pero en mi caso es lo único. Vivo en República Dominicana y es más costoso devolverlo que adquirir otro. Conclusión: NO ME GUSTA, prefiero el "Fire tv".

First, it was not working with Xfinity wifi, had to spend some time googling around. Not acceptable for something that should be almost plug-n-play. Then when I managed to have it connected, it insisted in having me set a credit card (and no info about how much they wanted to charge), no way to go around that screen.I have most of my streaming from Netflix, Fubotv, Youtube, so don't want to pay more for content, just want to have an extra option to rent movies, and then setup CC info if i want to. By being too pushy, you lost my business Roku.

This little unit gives you Roku access. Great!BUT... the Roku interface itself requires you to use arrow keys to peck through an on-screen keyboard in order to search for content. ARGHHHHH!!!!! It is SO PAINFULLY SLOW!! If you want to watch a 2 hour movie, be sure to budget and extra 10 minutes to peck, peck, peck your way through the on-screen keyboard, and then an extra 15 minutes to knock down a couple of drinks to help recover from the agony. After that, on with the show!

I bought a couple of these Roku express devices, hoping to save some money and still get the same quality experience as the previous TVs and players we had from Roku. However, the remote is incompatible with Roku TVs and does not have a volume button. The sticky tape provided for mounting the device is very weak and I needed to buy additional adhesive to keep it in the place. Lastly, the charging port is very fragile, the device fell about 2 feet and the charging port bent to the point it will not hold the charging cable anymore. I would suggest sticking to one of the more premium Roku devices.

I had to return it back because it was $120 to activate the roku. The customer service was very rude when I asked why I have to pay $120 then his response was the roku for poor people can’t pay channels . I don’t think he knows what his talking about this person don’t need To be a customer service because he is very rude . He thinks that people only buys roku because they are so poor can’t pay cable . That’s not the way you selling stuff other wise he needs customers service training ..

We purchased this for our son’s room for him to watch Disney+ and YouTube TV, as his older smart TV didn’t support those apps. I was disgusted and incredibly disappointed by the screen savers available and the content available on this device.  I was NOT able to filter and block pictures of naked women from the screensaver store on this.  We are trying to safeguard our home and the content allowed in it, yet this thing was loaded with mature images that I could not block.  This needs revamped and redone.  There is no need for filth on a Roku.

I have an older T.V. RCA HDMI 40'  I have Uverse basic internet so the HD quality is the same as before using my blueray player...but the free channels and the ease in which I was able to set it up is worth it!  Don't enter a credit card #.,And you may have to resend your code for another if it doesn't take the first code.

Best Roku yet! I've been buying Roku devices since they first came out. I have the box, stick and now this one. It's the best I've for sure. The picture quality beats the fire stick. My fire stick was always disconnecting from the internet and the picture quality wasn't as good. Only about downside about Roku is the absence of Bluetooth capability so you have to connect through the Roku app and link it to your Bluetooth speakers. Roku has always been that way though.

Love the Roku TV & everything about it verses the costs for cable or satellite TV.  You still ha E to subscribe to a cable alternative service to get your local channels, but it is still much cheaper than satellite TV.  This is a great device to get if you already have internet service. You have to have internet service with a wifi router & download speed of atleast 200mbyts & 20mbyres of upload speeds.  The only thing I don't like about this is the volume controls  d mute are on the side of the remote. Roku device very easy to set up & I highly recommend this device with a YouTube TV subscription for your local channels & a full package of sports channels including big 10 network.  You can Share your subscription with up to 6 family members or friends.

We had to get our cable bill under control so we decided to start with getting rid of three out of four cable boxes. My buddy had a Roku which he raved about so we thought we'd give it a shot. I got one to start with to see how difficult it was to set up and the quality of the picture you get. The set up was a breeze. The most difficult thing was remembering the passwords on the apps we added. Since we kept our main cable box, we simply added the Spectrum app to the Roku menu. You just don't have the convenience of getting around the cable channels easily with the simple Roku remote like you did with the cable remote. That's really nothing, though. I loved the first one so much I ordered two more right away!

I’m very impressed with my Roku. It arrived fast and I promptly cancelled cable and purchased a monthly subscription to YouTube TV for live streaming - but you don’t really even need that if you mainly stream movies and shows. There are tons of channels that come with the Roku which provide several free movies/shows. In fact, here I am a couple months after use of my Roku thinking about cancelling the Tube too (but the hubby loves the live sports so I best not). Seriously, you can literally pay the one time flat fee for the Roku device and be done with coming out of pocket for entertainment television so long as you have WiFi. I know, tubular right!?P.S. I do NOT write reviews for products that give away money or free stuff if you give them a 5 star review...Instead I return those products to their shady vendors 😉

This roku player is great and the only difference is the remote with Ultra version.I did felt volume button is important and went ahead to buy the ultra version because of that I discovered other differences as well

I have in my house three different (don't ask me why, all of them are presents to me) models - Roku, Amazon fire stick and Chromecast stick. The last one is the very worst one having a hard time to communicate with latest Samsung model. Amazon fire stick is good as well, but Roku to my personal experience is the best - easy to install, easy to work, and it is very reliable. What possibly else you can ask for - it is much worth for the price and for the service. I love it, therefore I got another one and Chromecast would sit in the box forever. Thank you Roku designers.

Don't get me wrong. For $24, this device can turn any TV into a smart TV. I had to make the switch to Roku because I recently switched to an Internet version of Cable TV and the app didn't work on my fire stick or old AppleTV. I bought the $50 version and the $24 to compare them. On the surface, these appeared to have very similar features, but this one lacks an RF remote which means it requires an IR receiver (included, but clunky). The remote also lacked controls for the TV (power, volume) which means you still need your TV remote. It also lacked the voice control, which I didn't think would be a big deal, but makes the user interface a bit more painful. The Wifi also seems to be not as strong as the 4k. All in all, the interface is the same, but I would go with the more expensive one to get a better remote, better connectivity, and better streaming (4k vs. HD).
when i connect it to tv nothing happened even i try to put my tv in hdmi. still nothing happen. its not responding even i already connect it

I didn't have TV for a year and I decided it was time for something, so I got a Roku.Warning: The first one I got was defective. After it connected to the internet, it went to a bouncing logo screen and stayed there....forever. Apparently this is a pretty common thing. (Knocking off a star because Roku customer support was not helpful at all.) Once I had tried everything I could think of, I chalked it up to a defective model and exchanged it. Writing this review in case the logo issue happens to anyone else. It is super annoying and seemingly un-fixable if you don't have a memory card in it (apparently if you do have a card in it, removing the card can fix the problem).

I ordered this instead of the newer Roku stick because the room where we want to use it doesn't get wifi. The description of the product does not tell you that it only works on wifi and doesn't have an ethernet port. Even if we had wifi, the ethernet cable would be a much faster connection, so it is very disappointing that they don't disclose this important feature in the description. Can't use it. Sending it back.

Received my Roku today and I must say I am impressed. Was using a PS3 to stream apps before but some apps wouldn't play. The Roku plays ALL of my apps Netflix, Prime, Hulu, PlutoTv Crackle etc! And the streaming is perfect. Unboxing is simple and there is NO ACTIVATION FEE. Just got to Roku.com and follow the activation instructions. They will ask you to set up any future payments on a card but it will not be charged. And you can go back in and delete the info after account is set up. Or use a card that has a few bucks on it to keep it open. Do not pay anyone else for an activation fee, that is not Roku. All in all, good choice on my end.

In response to several warnings by tech blogs and newsletters that older Roku would soon be losing updates and other tech and content support, I purchased this replacement.  I found it very easy to install, and other than having to re-enter all my usernames and passwords, etc., for subscription channels, it was a breeze.  The Roku system re-loaded all my preferred and subscription channels, and the new unit seems to be much faster powering up, moving between channels and providers, etc.The only thing I didn't like is that the new remote does not have the sound volume controls on the side like my older remote.  Fortunately, the old one works with the new Roku unit, so the new remote goes into a drawer as a backup.

My husband was skeptical with this and was even suggesting we get more cable boxes for our house.  No longer needed, as our provider has an app for the Roku.  It was very easy to set up as long as the intructions were followed. Absolutely no issues.

I haven’t used it yet, but I set up my new Roku Express today.  I replaced my Roku 1 because I have a free one year subscription to Apple TV+.  The set up was not as simple as I thought it would be but it wasn’t hard.  You need a computer or smart phone to go online to your account to input a code that comes up on the screen during set up.  I also needed a converter because my tv is very old.  Once it’s set up it gives you a one minute video to introduce the remote and where to find things.  So far I’ve only set up Netflix.  The screen looks more like when I sign on through my iPad than it when I used my Roku 1.  We will start streaming tonight.

Amazon asked about volume control. I dont know about that but what i do know is for $25, even at only 1080p, when paired on my $60 Seiki 40-inch TV, its the bomb. Is even good at streaming in a somewhat dead zone of house.

So I bought this because I had an older Firestick on a not smart TV in my bedroom and it started to disconnect from my WiFi all the time and took so long to load. I bought a new 4k Firestick and had the same problems after I spent an hour setting it up, restarting several times. I ordered the Roku and had it tue next day.  Setup took 10 minutes, the homescreen loaded immediately and I logged into Netflix. Best decision ever! FYI, there is NO fee to use ROKU. You have to go online to set up an account and the first thing that will show up when you search will be a website that is NOT Roku. Make sure you go to the Roku website.

I've had the Roku for 2 weeks now and overall I really like it!  I've switched from the Amazon Fire stick which stopped working 2 days before getting the Roku!  I was able to install the Amazon App giving me access to Prime movies.  That is a plus!  I cut Xfinity cable but I'm able to stream the local channels!  I believe the picture quality is even better!The one thing I would like is to be able to turn the TV on/off and TV volume button!  I did see that other Roku models have these abilities.  At this point, I will probably order a Roku Universal remote! Plus, I see the kiddos loosing one at some point!  Again, overall I would purchase again!

We have the Roku stick and loved it but for our spare room we wanted a more budget friendly option as it will not be used as much. I definitely recommend this roku as it is exactly as described however, until I had the remote that did it all I didn't know what I was missing. Definitely spend the extra little bit to get the roku with the voice remote and power button. This one does not have that ability but it is still a great buy.

I have a few older 42" smart tvs that the embedded apps have stopped support on, so they don't work.  This device lets me get to YouTube/Netflix again along with giving me newer options like Plex/Hulu/Sling/Disney+.  Essentially making a tv I would just use for Video Game Consoles and letting me stream to it.Pros:

Previously was streaming through a Sony Bluray Player and it was painful ! It would take forever to load up, would get hung up scrolling through the program choices and the Audio would randomly drop out. This Roku rocks!! It also has an Iphone app to control it that also enables you to attach your headphone to listen privately for example at night when  other are sleeping. What also knocked me out is I couldn't understand a line so I rewound it twice and it AUTOMATICALLY put up the subtitles in the area I rewound to  and then they turned off automatically when I was watching  in virgin territory I hadn't seen yet! VERY COOL!  BUY IT!!

I live by myself, can't stand local t.v. station, cable us too expensive plus the shows are the greatest...with Roku you are in 100% in control; if you want to pay for a premium channel you can and it doesn't come with other yucky stations. I watch YouTube 95% of the time, I already am a Prime member so I can watch movies on that channel and Netflix has many great shows. I'm very happy with this product!!

Oops, my bad. I bought a piece of junk trying to spend the least amount of money. THREE levels of volume only, with no volume control, AND... my tv remotes don't work when using the Roku. This is a joke. This HAS to be a joke. There is pretty much no way to watch anything, particularly if there are commercials, with any comfort. Dialogue will be too soft, and the commercials TOO LOUD. Loud enough to disturb the neighbors, yet can't hear the actual show. And I stupidly threw away the box so I can't return it. I like Roku, but this product of theirs is a piece of junk. There is no reason why, in the 21st century, a remote or operating system should have a static volume control. I'd laugh but I'm just irritated.
Not Compatible with YouTube TV.  Purchased the Roku Express with the hope of using it with YouTubeTV but it is not supported.  Otherwise Great device

Thanks to changes on a certain streaming channel (not Amazon), I had to purchase replacement units.  The first purchase was for my sister, so I was able to check out the quality and ease of installation before purchasing for myself.  It was very easy to install and we didn't have any problems with it.  I then ordered two additional units for home and am just as pleased with them.I have used the Roku brand since 2008 when I finally ditched satellite and went with local channels.  I not only enjoy the local offerings, but the many free channels provided by the Roku, along with a couple of pay-to-stream channels.

💘 💘 love my roku . When activating it stated connection failed and referred me to call a numbet which tried to make me pay an activation fee but after going thru the motion with them ( back and fort ) my rroku tv finally becsme activated . Nothng but scammers that have somehow linked themselves to the activation process . When activating , Roku clearly states on the screen that there are no activation or service fee . They gave me a hard time , but I was not falling for their scram . I didnot pay 1 red cent for activation ! I cannot stand scammers !

I bought this because I read Netflix was dropping support for my older Roku, and both Prime and YouTube no longer worked on that older Roku.  You must have your network password and the names and passwords you use for Prime, Youtube, Netflix, and I guess any other special channels like that.  It's not difficult to set up, just time consuming.  I had to do it on the internet as the device itself would not accept my information.  But overall, well worth the time spent setting it up AND I can now watch Youtube, Prime, and it will support Netflix after Dec. 1.  This is a tiny little device but it's powerful and I'm very happy with it.  For the price?  Well worth it.

Every time, and I do mean every time, I switch to Roku, I get an HDMI error screen. I'm using all the supplied cables, but it has to be unplugged and plugged back in every stinking time. I go through the menu, pick the service, pick the program, and it isn't until the program loads that the error screen displays, telling me the HDMI is messing up. You get the audio, but only the error screen for video. I will have to return for a bigger unit. The 2 older ones have worked like champs for years, but the stick I got through Best Buy overheated every time (yes, I got the tiny extension HDMI cable), and now this Express has issues. It's old.

It is supplied with a plug in the event there is not enough power through the USB connection. Unfortunately, if that's the case and you want to conceal the cords behind the television, this plug sticks out from the outlet behind the television about 2. 25 inches.  You have to shim out the wall mount enough that you can plug it in to the outlet if you are using a fixed mount that doesn't telescope away from the wall. Either that or you have to use a special electrical box designed for artwork that is recessed into the wall.So, if you want to conceal the cord and you don't have enough power through the USB, you may need to make modifications or use a telescoping mount.

I wanted to love this but doesn’t stay connected to the internet. Picture and audio are great, when it stays connected.  I tried all the trouble shooting tips but it didn’t solve my issues. Returning and buying another Fire Stick.

I've had both Roku and Fire Stick before, and I'm sorry Amazon, but Roku is the best. Unlike the Fire Stick, you never have to clear the cache on this thing. It never gets bogged down and it never really lags (unless it's for a second, and it's usually an app error, not a Roku error). There are more options available on the Roku and it solidly integrates all of your accounts across the devices. So I never have to log in to every single app. Just once with my login info for DirecTv and then all apps that use that are automatically synced. Excellent usability, and easy interface.

I bought 2 of these. They work amazing. Saves a lot of money compared to Paying for cable. We use Netflix and youtube... and that has been enough for us. They do have tons of free kids shows and channels which is very nice. I have not had any issues with the signal at all. The only thing I would like to point out is that the remote does not have volume buttons. So you will definitely be using your other remote for that. Does not bother us. Just wanted to point it out just in case. I really enjoy have Roku Tv. And also... there is no such thing as an activation fee. Just make sure to follow the instructions in the box and you should have any issues.

Ok, so I have been a fire TV user FOREVER. I still have some in my house, but I'm replacing them with Roku units and TVs. FireTVs are slow, filled with ads, have overheating problems. It's hard to find content, and good luck with getting the Alexa remote stuff working. Roku is AWESOME - they have by far, the best and most fully featured catalog of applications and TV content. It's easy to look up content, and play native content. Did I mention how fast this UI is? Slick as butter, very responsive, and not full of a bunch of ads. I can't stress how awesome this thing is - 20 stars.

If you are buying a Roku hoping to get away from a lot of ads then don't bother. I bought this because I was told that there were not many ads however with my experience watching some shows that were roughly 30 minutes long I got between 25 and 30 ads broken up into ad breaks consisting of anywhere from 3 - 6 ads each break. A HUGE disappointment and not at all what I was expecting. The plus side would be that the device is small and compact so it hides away easily, the setup was fairly simple and the picture quality was fine for me. I don't have a 4k tv though so I can't speak to what it looks like on that kind of screen.

First of all there is no charge for activating  this device, people that claimed that were either scammed or gave a bogus  review...This looks great on a 1080p monitor, but you have to have a monitor with built in speakers or a headphone output, the speakers on my monitor (Sceptre 24" 1080p 75 hz) suck so I hooked up a mini soundbar using the headphone output, You also need a HDMI input

Why did i wait so long? Went through 3 fire sticks since inception. Lived with chronic buffering, restarting and lag for years. This boots faster than my tv, nothing has buffered. Apps are not flaky unlike on firestick. You can watch prime, so not missing anything! No speaker hole for privacy. Win win, and cheaper than stick. I have roku tv in my room, not sure why i was hesitant to use their device as it blows fire devices out of the water. Easy setup
I don't recommend purchasing this streaming device. There are streaming devices that function much better.Positives:

I just got it today . I specifically got those for my Samsung TV because I couldn't get thr Disney Plus on.Roku was super easy to install. Has alot of great features and Disney Plus worked juat great.

For the Roku product line, you certainly can't beat the price. It's a minimum-frills device, perfect for the budget-conscious or persons needing a streamer for an older, smaller 720 or 1080 TV screen. (It does not deliver UHD.) One thing to note: it only connects to WiFi thru the 2.4GHz band. In my house, I have 2.4GHz and 5GHz dual band routers, and the networks have the same SSID/passwords on both bands. If attempting to control the Roku via their iOS app and my phone is connected to the 5GHz band, it can't "see" the Roku on the 2.4GHz band and gives a connection error. (What's odd is the individual channel control apps like YouTube, Netflix etc. all seem to find the Roku fine.) An internet search for this issue yielded a support page that advised this could be encountered.

CANT CONNECT ANY BLUETOOTH KEYBOARDS that sucks. Have fun typing in all of your passwords with UP LEFT RIGHT DOWN button's only. VERY TIME CONSUMING and cumbersome vs. connecting 1 bluetooth keyboard or 1Keyboard on my Mac and just using that to sign up for multiple services.Different models. This model had the cheap remote without the volume control. If I get a roku I'd get the one with the volume control. But the 1st reason I gave is a dealbreaker. Too slow of a setup process and that matters if it breaks and I have to do it all over again.

This model doesnt allow you to operate your TV (no power button or volume button) but I bought this for our dining room tv to replace our old firestick. I am so happy with the speed and quality of the streaming... I dont mind having to use the 2 remotes  because we only use this tv while cooking dinner or to entertain the toddlers while doing chores... roku does offer a more universal device but this Express model is perfect for my needs. Roku streams Xfinity cable, if it werent for that we might have ordered another (newer) firestick. But I'm glad we didnt

My wife and I were using our LG Blu Ray player to stream Netflix, Hulu, and YouTube but always had issues with lag and freezing. Eventually, Hulu would completely stop running. On top of that, there was no way for us to update our player to include streaming for Disney Plus so we decided to take a gamble on the Roku Express. Just had to plug it in, sign up for a free account, and activate it. Super easy to set up. So far, we've been able to stream all the apps we've downloaded without any issues at all. My only concern is that the device seems to get really hot after a small period of use.

I have another Roku (SKU #3900R) that works perfect and this one (SKU #3930R) that I bought later which is more compact and keeps loosing connection. I also upgraded my modem thinking that was the problem but to no avail. It also seems to have no return available. I need to be more careful in the future about Amazon purchases. The older version I got from Target and I could return it if I had this problem.

I already had 3 firesticks for my other tvs and decided to try this on a 4th tv. Roku makes you give them all your personal info as well as credit card. Obviously they are trying to pull you into their "sphere" so they can keep soaking you. However, this remote took 2 hours to load the stations and then was too slow to load causing buffering issues--none of which I have with the firesticks. Shame on Roku for allowing such a weak product to have their name on it. It went right back and I ordered another firestick (which has Alexa built in anyway). It's a whole $11 more.

My very old ROKU player bit the dust a few months ago. I finally decided to get another one. I had no idea how cheap they are now. This little one replaced it for a fraction of the price. It arrived today and was set up in less than ten minutes. Simple. And - it works! I do not understand what fees people are talking about in these reviews. When I hooked it up there was a message clearly stating that ROKU does NOT charge fees. This player is exactly what I needed and I just wish I would have bought it sooner. The old one was archaic.

Every evening while watching a movie on Prime, this thing suddenly tells me it has lost connection to the internet.I have to go back to HOME, then back to Prime to continue watching the film. The first few minutes the film is not full resolution but then settles down.

Having tried the Firestick, I find the Roku to be more response, easier to identify onscreen what is being selected,  and the number one thing, I do not constantly have to unplug and plug it back in to its USB power and reset it to get it to work.Additionally, the Roku interface is straight forward. Instead of getting advertisements like one does on the Firestick, Roku provides me with the installed apps and quick links to items I need. I like it so much, I'm moving this one to the guest bedroom and buying the improved model with volume control.

I love the Roku setup! I purchased this as a second device to use in another room in my home. Because I already had an existing Roku account, setup was very easy after I logged in on my phone. I did have to download some apps that weren't loaded on during setup, but all has been well since purchase! I've noticed that sometimes when starting up and opening an app, I get an error stating that I need to turn my tv off and unplug the Roku from the tv and restart. I've noticed that this may have been an issue with my tv, because I've since changed it to a different HDMI port and haven't had the issue.

The Roku express had a difficulty just getting setup. I plugged it in, and the ROKU logo would bounce up and down. I had to unplug and replug the ROKU to get it working again. This happened again if I paused too long trying to activate the account. I got it to work for a little while, and things were fine, but within 2 days, I got the boot loop again, and nothing would fix it. I unplugged, waited 30 seconds and replugged. I changed the HDMI cable and the port. I checked the tv with other casting devices to ensure the tv wasn't broken.I'm getting a replacement on the chance that the ROKU I got was defective, but it's disappointing that I had problems with setup right out of the box, and then complete failure 2 days later.

Been a happy Roku user for many years now.  Got this unit to add to one of my bedrooms.  Everything went fine and I'm overall happy with the purchase and plan on keeping it.There are 2 concerns I do have with it. 1) The remote that comes with it doesn't have an intergrated 3.5mm audio jack like my other Roku 3 units I own.  I really like that option and really wish this one came with it.  2) It's overall speed is much slower than my older Roku 3's.  I noticed when I tested it that it took almost 25 seconds for the screen resolution to sharpen up so the picture was smooth.  Every video I pulled up looked grainy but 25 seconds later looked alot better.

Let me first off start by saying I normally love roku I have used them for years . But this is my second new model and after sending the first one back I am now sending the second one back they both seem to overheat and disconnect from WiFi. Very frustrating if you are watching more than a few hours. I like to have my tv on while working and after a few hours it just stops working. If you shut it off for awhile it works again for a few hours. Why anyone would design something like this I have no idea but the heading should be good for a few hours of tv then one hour of cool down !

This product was so much better for streaming our go-to subscriptions. Hulu, Netflix, and Amazon Prime Video at the touch of a button on a remote. Plus, you get the whole Hulu channel guide for Live Tv.I liked it so much I bought two. BUT, the Hulu guide recently stopped working and every time you select the guide, the Roku backs out to the main screen. So frustrating!!!

Just like everyone else said, the set up was very easy.  The only hard part is getting signed in to Netflix, Hulu, etc., and picking content.  No fault of Roku and my wife loves it.  We now have a smart TV that wasn't one before.  Saved me some money until we buy a new TV.  Worth every cent.The only thing I couldn't figure out was how to run it through my receiver to get better sound.  Oh well, I may figure it out later or just be okay with the tv speakers.  Still a great product.

I'm very happy with my Roku. Even a Luddite like me could set it up and now I'm enjoying all my Amazon prime shows/movies (Brideshead and Downton forever), plus incredible YouTube arts documentaries that I never knew existed. I expect there's more to get out of it, but for now that's fine. Good-bye 11-inch laptop screen.UPDATE: Three days later. The remote has stopped working. Roku makes different remotes and my mine is the basic without something called the pairing button. So frustrating and annoying. I will try different batteries before returning. I've been online, to YouTube, to no avail.

We found this to be a confusing maze of passwords, cable subscription approvals, subscription sign ups, and free trials.  It's sort of like a portal to 1000 other services, and whichever you select will has it's own independent account.  So I guess it's OK.  A+ for screen quality and OS.  Note you can't even activate this thing without a "payment method".  So make sure you are at home, have a credit card in hand, and your entire password inventory.
Great size and great price for our bedroom TV+ price

Im so happy with this product. Wish I would gotten it alot sooner. Was a easy setup and allows me to put all my apps on it and add more within 5 minutes or less. I totally reccomend it if you dont have a smart TV. I initially thought i would have to get rid of my plasma TV but i really live the clarity and color and did some research and came across this Roku device and didnt wait...got it in a few days and boom, hooked it up and I'm so happy I dont have to watch only movies in the living room or off my phone.  Super happy customer! Also it's very small so doesnt take that much space at all . literally fits in the Palm of your hand. Comes with the HDMI cord that goes from device to tv and power cord from the small device to outlet and remote. I give it 5 stars. Thanks Roku!

I spent 6 hours over two days attempting installation on two different Toshiba TV's with my streaming device, including watching available videos and help info.  I never was able to get beyond the Roku logo on my screen with one TV and the other one showed a picture one quarter of the screen size.  After several attempts reinstalling, and unable to contact a live person at Roku for assistance, I finally returned the item to Amazon. I received an email on 5/9/20 from Amazon saying I had been given the credit but it's not showing on my statement.  Now, adding insult to injury, I've wasted an hour with 3 different Amazon Customer Service people, including a so-called Specialist who disconnected my call.  The only consolation is that I chose to sell my Roku stock right after this experience and made 177% profit from it at its 52-week high. I then ordered the Amazon Fire Stick which I easily installed in a few minutes!  Even though Amazon's current Customer Service via telephone is inadequate, I will give them credit for a much better product for those who want to cut their cable service.

I would have given this five B stars if I don’t have such a hard time trying to connect the WiFi the first five times. Make sure you enable network pings, which did the trick for me. There are plenty of YouTube videos that will teach you have to do that. Other than that, this was totally worth the investment, especially when cable companies change the contract after 6 months to a year depending on the company. Not to mention we were paying for hundreds of channels we weren’t using. Now with all types of streaming packages, you’re better of purchasing this to stream all of these. The downside is I wish YouTube not YouTube Tv was accessible and free. It would be nice to watch random YouTube videos on the big screen.

I am writing this review not so much about the product, which so far appears great. But I was very glad I read reviews ahead of time, especially regarding a possible additional fee to activate the Roku account. So I knew ahead of time that  any attempt to collect a fee was fraudulent. Even still I was led down the garden path... until I realized what was happening and shut the conversation down.  The important thing to watch out for is the point at which you have to go to your computer to enter an activation code from your TV screen. Here you can easily end up going to a scammer site that promotes a telephone number: " Any problem, call us !!" In your face promotion of a support telephone number. Back out and check the site and look carefully for Roku's genuine site. Much less in your face promotion and quickly you get the right kind of support without a solicitation.Other than that, the set up was super easy and I'm happy so far:).  You need to set up a Roku account ahead of time - again no charge!)

Love the Roku Express. We bought the Roku because we can't stream our cable service app on our FireStick which is really disappointing. We installed it on the TV in our office and it works fantastic and lets us stream all our favorite apps and yes that includes the Spectrum app which I wish was included on our FireStick. The only downside of the Roku is that the remote doesn't control the TV like power or volume which we love about the FireStick, but I guess it's the price we have to pay to get the Spectrum app. Other than that, it's a great streaming device and at a really fair price.

I didn't like that PayPal account info or debit/credit card info was required to create a Roku account during setup. Payment info shouldn't be required until at a later time if/when the customer chooses to do any action that requires payment.

I bought this to replace a Roku Stick I had purchased at Walmart.  The stick really sucked.  It got hot and would drop the audio after using it for about an hour.  I tried all the fixes I could find on line including the Roku sight.  I discovered that the sticks might overheat and have problems.This unit works great!  All my Roku issues are solved.  And the stick remote control works with it when paired so I still have power, volume and the mic that don't come on the remote for this device.  If I were buying a Roku for the first time I'd get one with the better remote control.  But this is great for the budget.

We have a Roku Ultra 4K  at home and I got this for an older 720p non-smart TV at our weekend cabin.  We don't have the bandwidth at the cabin to stream in 4K so this basic roku works fine but it is bare bones without the same search and configuration options as the higher end model.  And although the remote has a similar look to the Ultra remote it is flimsy and awkward in your hand.  But otherwise it work basically the same as any other Roku and the low cost makes this a great option for our needs.

I bought this for a tv in the basement that had an old first gen Firestick that was painfully slow. This was a welcomed upgrade. Fast, easy to setup, simple. We have many Rokus in the house, so it’s a trusted brand for us. Definitely don’t fall for any scam that says you have to pay $100. That’s definitely a scam. Type in the web address in your browser and make sure you are not clicking on a searched link. I didn’t experience this, but it looks like some people have been taken for a ride. Yikes.

Just so everyone knows all of a sudden you have to pay to have the Roku box! As of July 2020 it's $60 for 3 years. Which is fine but it clearly says that there is no activation fee! So they changed the word to update! If you want to turn your Roku box on you have to pay for an update! It will not work without the update so basically you're paying for activation! I would have no problem paying it but I do not like being lied to they should say there is an activation fee that it needs an update for $60! Instead of saying it's free because it clearly is not free!

The 2019 version the Roku Express doesn’t support modern wireless protocols. This isn't made clear in the description. This isn’t listed on the product packaging, the manual, or their website. Testing, and another review are the only reasons i know this now. If I had known before I would have purchased a different product. I’m not a fan of Roku’s “you must give us your credit card number” demand either, but it’s better than Amazon’s Fire stick. I should have purchased a Chromecast; never tried one it could be worse, might be better.

I bought this for easy access to Disney+ and I’m glad I did!  Super easy setup and install, and easily customizable for what we want. There is no fee like many report and Roku is very quick to point that out. Picture and audio quality is great, and performance is amazing.My only gripe, I can’t customize the quick access buttons on the remote, but it hardly slows down accessing the content we want.

I am actually a huge fan of Roku but this version of it I absolutely hate. I have issues with it freezing ALL the time. And I swear it has a motion sensor bc anytime I pause it then leave the room... once i step back in it automatically starts playing. It is the creepiest thing ever. This wasn’t just a one-time thing.. this happens every.single.time.I’m pretty frustrated.

I have to reboot my router and modem EVERY time I want to watch CBS All Access.  If not, it just loads, plays, loads, plays until it drives me crazy.  Sometimes after rebooting it still won't play.  Netflix and Amazon Prime work fine but I actually bought the Roku for CBS All Access.  My WiFi is fine as all other streaming services work like they are supposed to.

I first discovered Roku when I bought a Roku enabled TCL TV and love the convenience and ease of use of this service!  I will now only buy Roku enabled TV’s and purchased the Express device for the living room TV we bought prior to knowing about Roku.  We mostly use it for Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, and Disney+, but the variety of channels is exceptional.  Why pay hundreds of dollars for a streaming device (like Apple TV) when you can get the same functionality with such an affordable option such as Roku?

I decided to cut the cord so I bought this for my LR TV.  This TV was one year older than one needed to get most streaming of “Live” shows so had to get a Roku.  I have an older Roku that I used on my bedroom TV and it works fine.  This new one that I just bought and installed a couple of weeks ago has given me so much grief with the buffering.  I don’t find it a problem usually on Amazon Prime or other Non-live streaming.  It is sporadic but sometimes goes on for a couple of hours at a time. When it has happened, I go and turn on my bedroom TV to the same exact streamer and channel and have no problems. I have internet speeds of at least 100 mbps and speed tests have verified that I am getting those speeds.  I can only conclude that it is this latest Roku which appears to be a piece of junk!

Bought to replace a 2014 Roku that would not support the newer big apps.  I am returning this for the following reasons:  1) Keeps switching to a small screen in upper left corner, have to unplug Roku to make it return to regular.  2) Hulu, Netflix, Sling, BritBox and others all have "connection" issues that normally will resolve themselves after 10-20 seconds.  If not, you have to yet again unplug and restart.  This problem cannot be a connection issue as these apps work fine on another Roku and an Xbox.  3) Sometimes will lose video yet audio continues, particularly after commercials.  Have to hit pause, then fast forward or rewind to restart video.  Way too many issues just to get through a show or movie.  Not worth it.

this is alright...didn't mirror very good with the smat TV...works better with the not so smart TV.( firestick works better on both tv's) ..no internet here - mirroring is a must for decent movies - tried the satellite internet and that was a joke!

I have a couple more Roku's but wanted to replace one that was over 8 years old.  When I attached, it gave a code, as this is a familiar part and then you are suppose to just hook up.  Well, I got a message I needed to call an 800 number for assistance, who then wanted to charge me $89.95 for a 3 year plan.  Yikes.  I hung up, and went into my ROKU ACCOUNT and connected there at no charge.  Just be careful folks.  I have no idea what that was, or if somehow evil sites can somehow get in your way of hooking up.  ROKU channels do not cost a cent.  And there are no 3 year plans to get your roku working.

I love these devices. I bought this one because my Roku 3 fell in a bucket of water. I have 3 of them and I absolutely love them. I like the prices of the Rokus. You can take them anywhere.... providing you have Internet. I pay FAR less than what is asked for by satellite and cable providers. Once you have decided what you want to watch, there are packages or ala carte videos. I like it because I can binge watch tv series....catch up on movies etc.I have nothing attached to my home, or a 4 hour window wait for a installation at $90. It’s so liberating!

Works great. Pretty easy to set up.  Im surprised at the responsiveness of the menus and interface.  Its not like a cable box, where everything is so sluggish.  Scrolling through the menu almost feels like I am doing so on a well appointed computer.Picture quality is A+.  Im surprised how good it is on top of being fast. No hiccups, no interruptions as if I was streaming off my computer, and perhaps better in fact with certain applications. I havent tested them all.  Mainly using Amazon prime video.

I love having my Roku! I don’t like my internet speed it kinda sucks, but the Roku is lit! And it’s extremely easy to navigate if my 19 month old baby can get the Tv on and out Disney plus on to watch Frozen for the 100th time anyone can figure out how to use the Roku. My only hang up I wish it had like a parental control that you need to put in a code before buying something. My daughter ordered ESPN :( that’s 60 bucks! I will stick with my review that the Roku is excellent and I highly recommended for streaming! Just keep the remote away from littles.

Thank goodness I ordered this new Roku Express! My old (2014) Roku streaming stick had seen better days. My older model was SUPER SLOW at loading stations. This was so aggravating and it was time to retire the ole gal.  New Roku Express was super easy to install. Took me less than 20 mins and I was up and running again. So glad I decided on this updated, faster version! No regrets now! Thanks Roku!  Happy streaming!

My old one worked better.  HULU told me to buy a new one and was no longer available until I did get the new one.  My problem with the new one is it does not allow you to have a choice of what to watch next.  It goes directly into the next episode.  I have to pause it and jump completely out of HULU in order to choose what I prefer to watch. Highly irritating.  If I fall asleep in the middle of an episode, it just keeps playing episode after episode.  It is difficult getting back to the episode I was watching.

I bought this for use in hotels or similar rental places when I'm on travel, and it's perfect for that.  The roku interface is easy and consistent, and I can plug it into any TV (at least, any TV with an HDMI input) and it works perfectly.  No more entering all the different usernames and passwords for different streaming services, or not having access to some of them at all; just carry this and plug it in.I've seen reviews that criticize the product because the remote doesn't have a TV on/off button or a volume control, which is true, but that's not a bad thing if you plan to use it with different TV's.  In fact, it's actually better not to have an on/off button or volume control that you'd have to reprogram for every TV; this way is much cleaner and simpler.  Overall, I'm extremely happy with the purchase.

If you want to pay for all the streaming maybe you would like to buy a roku or Amazon stick. The device is good, but it was not what I was looking for. For the price is a very good option. The bad thing is that Roku blocked all the IPTV apps for their store, for example M3U players. I'm switching for a android tv box. For me is the best option, and comparing, a good TV box is quite better than any stick (roku, Amazon fire, Xiaomi, chromecast and so on..)

We have a Roku device and are very happy with it. Bought this one. Went to set it up, wouldn't activate. Call customer support and am told that there is a $58 registration fee to use the thing. Can't use Amazon Prime, HULU, Netflix, etc. The UI has been changed so there is no search function. Nothing works until I activate via a "one-time" payment. Totally unethical. I'm returning this device for a refund and shopping for a REPLACEMENT FOR MY OTHER ONE FOR WHEN THEY DECIDE TO "UPDATE" THAT ONE TO REQUIRE AN ACTIVATION FEE.

Roku forced me to "upgrade" from my old Roku XR model (which was perfect) so I got this for upstairs.  There's two principal irritations with this model.  First the wifi antenna is weak.  Every other wifi device shows perfect signal, but this couldn't get the signal from downstairs.  So I added an upstairs wireless access point, still it says signal "Fair."  That's some weak sauce.  It is usable though, with no stuttering.Second, there's a Prime video called "Rainstorm for sleep - black screen" and what it's supposed to do is completely blank out the screen while playing only the sound.  The Roku XR did this properly, but the Express leaves the backlight on the screen on (yes, it's the same TV).  So there's a gray glow in the room and it won't get completely dark.

If you are hoping this simple stick to work with a wireless router of the Linksys type..forget about it...I have tried this with three different Linksys WiFi Routers and even with the Roku HD Express right next to the router it does not stay connected and drops out so we ordered the type with a 10/100 Internet connection and / HDMI connector on the back of the box...this is not an Express model and it solved the problem...we give the Hard Wired Version a 4.75 star rating....we never give full 5 stars...but do not buy the HD express...if you are using wifi...it does not stay connected!

We have been using roku for about 2 years. It was nice to get out of paying for dish.We get the channels we want and pay for that alone. By pay i mean sling, hulu and well we already had orime. So i spent 30.00 bucks or so and thats it. If you are buying this system roku. There is NO activation so any of those comments on here are full of bull. Just bought a 2nd system and a replacement remote for 5 bucks cause my puppy ate the other. Again i love this system. Btw i have both fire stick and roku and in all honesty roku is the easier sustem to use.

My old Roku 1, which I bought in 2013, was not performing well anymore and I knew it was time to upgrade to a new model.  Since I don't have a 4K TV, the Roku Express was my choice.  I love it!  It's lightning fast when loading channels, plus I noticed a slight improvement in picture quality over my old Roku 1.  Its tiny size allowed me to mount it directly to the underside of my TV for a sleek look, and I can power it via my TV's USB port.  Nice!

This roku worked well for what i wanted to do and was the cheapest solution, but what they don't tell you anywhere that this Roku does not have a power off button or volume control even in the roku phone app volume control with your phone only works with some apps .... However you can turn it on with the remote just not off. Pretty bad design if you ask me. One way i did find a "hack" to turn the TV "off",  just open up youtube and play a video called 24 hours + of pure black screen. Kind of ridiculous but the only way to have a dark room if you don't want to get out of bed to turn it off if you want to sleep. Super annoying! ! If anyone has a better solution let me know.

Great product, beware of idiots who dont know how to set stuff up! Theres NO activation fee with roku! You simply make a account and add your card information so you can BUY APPS! You dont need to buy apps! Roku works this way! I recommend this roku for kids rooms or dorms, small apartments! No problem with it on my tv screen! It gives you the option how to set it up! If you have a gigantic ass tv you probably should buy the $80 roku! Not the express! Its not that hard to figure out.

I am very pleased with this unit.  Once I got use to its operation I have added many of the cable programs found on Dish TV minus all their many channels that only sell watches, clothes, and assorted potions, etc  I have the opportunity to get local news from surrounding cities.  Now, I am adding the Streaming Stick + for the big screen as I get closer to cutting the cable/satellite cord. I am pleased with the quality  of the picture and sound.

Free means free. Others who claim a sign up fee have found a scam page. Roku is aware of this and have changed their registration process. Not their fault. I now have 3 basic models. My two 55" Vizio TVs no longer support Netflix and Hulu. No need to buy a new TV with just a $30 fix. I also have one in the garage on an older tv to watch baseball and hockey on Fox Sports Go app with my subscription through DirecTV, along with many other apps and movies and TV shows.

The packaging seemed weird when it arrived. I opened it up and there was an insert offering a 1-800 number to call with any trouble. So I attempted to install the roku player and, surprise, it didnt work. I called the number and was connected to a LOUD call center in India. I hung up and they called me back -- SUPER CREEPY. I looked at the packaging more closely and realized that the website listed was not roku.com (official site) but for something just a bit off from that.The return process was easy - I brought it to Kohls and was refunded quickly.

We had an old Roku that never worked on my non-Smart flat screen tv, so I thought I’d try a newer version and I am very pleased.  I can now get Netflix and Hulu on my older tv! Easy set up, probably because we still had the old wires from the previous Roku. Remote is easy to navigate. There is also a way to set up without entering your cc number, just google it.......had some buffering issues which seems resolved by moving the Roku to the other side of the cable box so it’s slightly closer to the WiFi

Roku player works great however the power supply  does not work. I had to use my old roku power cord in order to set this up. Hopefully roku will replace/ exchange the power supply only as I spent quite a bit of time setting the roku up

Image is much better (way more detail) than my former Roku2 (which I really liked). Same easy set-up. I did not encounter any activation fee requests. Works great with my 2008 LGTV. Connectivity is good. Closed caption now works with Prime Video in addition to the Roku channel--it didn't at first and I'm not sure why it "kicked in", but I'm glad it did; that was my one "con". I do find the remote a bit awkward and preferred the remote on the older model, but that is not a dealbreaker for me. Overall, very happy with my purchase.

We have 4 televisions in our home and there are just two of us.  We have a Roku unit attached to each one.  They are a low cost item that we just refuse to live without.  We can download the widest variety of apps, some free and others that have a fee.  We are free to chose what we want and to watch what and where and when we want.  We have had one that started acting up but it was over 6 years old and the replacement  cost is so reasonable that changing it out is a non issue.

I had to replace our old Roku already included on our Sharp TV because it's old and it doesn't work on some apps. The old one does not need a power adapter that's why I like it. This item is not the stick type that you plug on HDMI and that's it, my first mistake, i thought it was and for this you need a sticker (included) else it will hang and it will be hard for the remote to work. To summarize it, I ended up getting Amazon fire when the price went down.

Dont buy this thing, Once  when you installed it will ask you for your credit card, id you dont summit this information , then you will not be able to watch any channel. I returned thi item  and they received it on april 28, 2020. According to "their policy, it takes 14 days once they received, then you will get your refund" Well. that's nonsense because it has  passed 14 days and I havent received my refund. I have tried to contact them but there is no way to do so. I am sure that once they see this rating they will take more seriously my refund request.

This is our second Roku express and this may be second time review.The express is so much better than the streaming stick device. The remote works all the time without delay.  Pages and menus load instantly. Updates went smoothly and relatively quick. Each streaming channel appears to be quicker and smoother interface.

Había utilizado el appletv viejo y chromcast con muy buenas experiencias pero decidí probar el Roku Express más por curiosidad y porque en la caja dice "compatible con alexa"Me decepcionó que solo sea compatible con redes wifi de 2.4ghz y no con la de 5ghz

This Roku was easy to install. You must first create an account, so that the installation will complete. I didn't do that, and ended up calling the phone number on the screen. The man said I had to pay $89, for which I declined, telling him "others I knew did not have to pay this fee." After creating an account, it was easy to finish the tv installation. Very happy that I can get channels in the upstairs bedroom, without having to rent another unit from my cable company.

I bought this for my dad, to replace his FireTV stick -- which has a very confusing user interface. We tried countless times over an evening for the Roku to update its software during the initial setup process. Each time it got to 49%, and then failed. Checking online, turns out this is not an uncommon occurrence. I also tried to update it via a cell phone hotspot, but that failed immediately. We're returning the Roku, and going back to the FireTV. Its interface is terrible, but at least it works.

We got a new Roku streaming stick. When we followed the directions to connect the device to our smart TV, it did not work at all. I called Tech Support and was told there would be a charge to fix the "technical problem". When I read the part of the Quick Start Guide that said set-up is free, the technician hung up on me. Luckily, Amazon was very helpful and offered a refund. Do not buy this device. I could barely understand anything the technician said anyway. There was definitely a language problem.

I set it all up, and then there was a bit of buffering when my toddler was trying to watch, I understand that though, it is streaming afterall. However later on the device was fast forwarding/skipping out of no where, the screen would sometimes go black and then come back. Not sure if it is the HDMI they sent me doing that? I have a firestick and ps4 that both have been used on that tv and I've never had an issue with picture or streaming. I'll be returning for a firestick. I was excited to try out Roku but, not for us.

From the photos, I just didn't realize how small this device actually is. It is tiny. And for the on screen performance that it delivers... wow! Plus roll in the Roku app store flexibility... wow again! Roku really supports their devices and that means that you are up-to-date with all of your online streaming needs and technologies.I have this connected directly to my AV receiver which feeds my projector. Picture quality and speed are simply excellent.

This Roku device is great! I've read some reviews about wifi bandwidth problems and activation fees. There is neither an activation fee nor problems with wifi. I have these all over the house and all of them work great!

I used to have a roku HD from like 2014. The old one was pretty slow and wouldn't really connect well when i tried to cast from my phone. This new one is like night and day. I cast to youtube almost instantly. I also like how it is a lot smaller than the previous one. I think its size is about 3 inches x 2 inches. great product to turn a "dumb tv" into a smartTV. Especially since this one is a lot faster than most of the smartTVs we have that are Samsung and from like 2014-2016

After being completely satisfied with several streaming stick +'s, we decided to add an express to a project room. The quality is right along with our other devices. My only gripe is not having a power or volume control with the remote. It's a bit slimy for the company to exclude them with the intent to force you to upgrade. There's no upgraded remote option. It pushes me to spend the money (again) and get a device that has them. Rendering the $30 decide i bought a waste of money.

This is our 2nd Roku product. This is a newer model, so a little different. Easy to follow directions and on screen prompts. I had it up and running within a very short time. Literally the hardest part is entering my passwords for our paid channels.

I purchased the Roku primarily to replace several Comcast boxes with the Roku and the Xfinity app  Getting all I need out of the Beta App from Xfinity without paying for the extra boxes. A bit different in presentation, but nothing that stops me from my monthly savings.I'd do it again and should have done it sooner!. Just follow the directions.  Still have and need my Xfinity primary box for main smart TV watching.  Roku was for all secondary TVs.

Loved this at first and it worked perfectly for about a month.  Not sure what happened but it no longer works with Hulu.  I can start shows, but ads cut off the show and then the video freezes on the ads but audio plays.  Hulu works great on my iPhone and computer so it is definitely a Problem with this Roku.  It is a super common problem with Roku users based on forums I have read dating back several weeks and Roku is not responsive to trying to fix it.  I am going to go back to Firestick.

I purchased the Roku device to replace my older Blu-Ray, which I used for my internet-streaming services, when that system no longer supported services like Netflix.
