I was quite surprised at how simple it is to attach and use. It gives me access to every one of my services, Netflix, Prime, Youtube, even the new Disney+, plus many more that I could apply for. And it cost less than a new Blu-Ray. Definitely the best solution for me.

I ordered this unit as a replacement for a Roku stick that inserted into a USB port on the back of my TV.  This new configuration allows the unit to be placed under the TV facing the remote, which is a significant improvement.  However, tho old one's remote also controlled the TV's sound volume, this one does not.  The remote will turn on my Vizio TV and select stations but does not turn off the TV or adjust volume, so we're using two remotes.

TONS of free shows &movie options, including youtube. I DID NOT have to pay activation fee. Be aware of scammers.Of course you also have your basic pay-for subscriptions. Many options that I did not know was available. Very user friendly.

We got this to expand a smart tv to be able to utilize additional services.  And so we could watch Black Mirror: Bandersnatch which will not play on Apple TV.  The user interface is not what I'm accustomed to, but the device does walk you thru setup and you really can't beat the price.

My original Roku Stick was no longer supported and due to age needed to be upgraded. I ordered the Roku Express to replace it and I LOVE IT. Easy to use, fast to set up and every app I could imagine is just a click away. I cut the cable cord in 2007, and I never looked back. Now I subscribe to a few streaming services, and for MUCH less than my cable bill, I have more content than I know what to do with. Great product and the price is excellent.

We had to upgrade our old Roku device, went with this model. I have to tell you, right off the bat the remote is so terrible that I'm considering returning it. The buttons are so stiff that my arms would get tired from punching in my Netflix password. That process took ages partially because of the aforementioned button stiffness and partially because the remote has awful responsiveness. It would not recognize button presses, or sometimes press twice instead. I thought this might be an issue with the app but it occurred on every app I set up.Picture quality is good, everything else is just about the same as my old Roku device. But the remote is GARBAGE.

I bought a roku for one tv and had no problems. Bought a second one and the 844 908 0708 number I had to call to activate my device, told me that if I have more than one device then you have to pay $69.99 to activate it... on screen it said roku never charges to activate a device... roku going back! Money grubbing whores who don’t speak English, very poor customer service... don’t waste your money!

I use these to watch all my Cable Channels - Amazon Prime & Netflix shows. Order these and sign into your cable provider and there you have it. No Extra Charge for boxes and remotes. Then sign into your Prime acct. and watch shows- then sign into Netflix and you get the point!!!!!!

I love the Roku tv’s that we have, so I decided to give this box a try for our older tv as well. Love the remote and options you can do with streaming, but if you’re watching anything with commercials, the screen started to get stuck after EVERY SINGLE BREAK after a few weeks. You have to mess with the video every time a commercial breaks ends in order to see the video again. I tried resetting it, different apps, and many other things to fix the problem with no change. I’d love my money back or a new device, but this one cracked out on me shortly before the return date ended.

This has opened up a lot of viewing option that I didn't previoously have.  Now can view just about anything by using apps and streaming items right into my home.  Everyone could use one of these, especially if you want to stream shows that are not accessible on your smart tv.  Recommend.

It does what you paid for. Includes many media outlets such as Netflix , Hulu, Youtube TV, Disney channel.  Very good price for accessibility to the popular providers at a reasonable resolution.  1080p is enough for anyone.Highly recommended to cut the cable and use these types of devices. No more fuzziness from bad coaxial cabling. Your picture quality is based only on your internet connection speed and how good your TV is with this device.

I didn’t want to discard my big box old school TV set that still has a great picture. So I did some research and in summary I purchased a HDMI to AV composite video audio converter and connected it to this roku device. To my delight my dumb TV set suddenly lit up like a new smart tv. Roku has an easy user interface. This is simply one of the best things I have bought in my life-besides my manual  non-electric paper shredder (from Amazon too!).

My old Roku2 was acting up and slow to load. I shopped for a Roku unit and was happy to see the price was lower than my original Roku2 unit. This unit is about half the size so more discreet than the older Roku. It was very easy to set-up. I do miss the headphone plug that used to be on the remote - now requiring you to use their app if you want to use headphones. The app works well, so I guess that's just the way technology goes.

This is my 2nd Roku. Both work well with every app except YouTube TV. Sometimes while changing channels the screen goes black and can only be fixed by using the home button and starting all over again. Roku blames YouTube TV and YouTube TV blames Roku. Lots of people having the same issue and no fix in sight. Everything else is good.

Roku should not advertise that a app is compatible with their product if it that app does not work in a consistent manner. Ads on Hulu the video and audio are out of sycn. I have to rewind a few seconds (not too many seconds because the the ad plays again). Between that the the weird "we having trouble" messages that pop up and stop the play. Other than that, I love my Roku ExpressUpdate: between Roku and Hulu the issue is fixed. No issues now. 5 stars.

I have the roku 1 an I just bought this one. the 1 can be hooked up to older TVs w rca Jack's. This one is smaller.  This one allows add ons. Some shows on prime wouldn't play on my roku 1 an it does with this one. This one doesn't have a headphone Jack on the remote but I was able to download the roku app on my phone an it allow you to listen threw ur phone w headphones on. The remotes are interchangeable too. Lots of free channels. Unlimited memory. I love my roku's

Me parece que es un buen producto, sin embargo para la región donde me encuentro (Venezuela) no están habilitado todos los servicios que ofrece, en el menú no tengo la opción de búsqueda, por lo tanto no puedo agregar nuevos canales, solamente puedo disfrutar de los canales predeterminados por el sistema, tampoco puedo descargar la app móvil. honestamente prefiero 10000 veces el FireTv Stick ya que me permite buscar y agregar otros canales.
Good once you set it up but wants you to create all these accounts and store a credit card. Didn't like that. Very inconvenient.

This is a great little device and so easy to set up. I have a Roku TV in my den but an older non smart LG tv in my master. I purchased this unit so that I could have access to what I watch downstairs. I use Youtube TV as my main streaming source with Netflix and Prime for movies. I am not on fast internet since I live in a rural area without internet providers except satellite. I use at&t wifi as my internet provider with the modem in my basement. I use a wifi booster on my main floor to push my signal to my master and I see no lag. Everything I have access to on my Roku TV I now have on my master bedroom tv. At this point I couldn't be happier with my purchase. As for a setup fee, which I saw on some reviews, there is none. You can choose to ignore the entry of credit card info if you are not going to purchase or rent Roku movies, and you don't have to accept premium channels. All in all, this was a great buy for me. Good luck.

Love this , turns my TV into a smart TV with access to pretty much any app possible,  saying good buy to my huge cable bill , I no longer need cable with my roku I can literally watch anything I want ,streaming services are so much more affordable,  and i love having access to Hulu and Disney +

I had been toying with the idea of getting a Roku for a while now. I have no interest in cable and I have an Amazon Prime account (comes with Prime Video) so I figured I'd try it. The price was great, plus I had a $5 Amazon gift card so for $20 this was a steal. I'm happy with the free videos that are available, and even if you wanted to rent or purchase certain things, it would be well worth it and still cheaper than cable. I also like casting whatever I'm watching on YouTube to my TV. It actually tricks me into thinking I have a smart TV lol. I love the fact that it comes with the HDMI cable. I can't say enough about it.

Bought this for parents, super tiny, only HDMI HDCP 1.4, no AV or USB for mp4 like our old Roku.Take it really slow when teaching since Roku concepts are very confusing at first. Parents run a DVR no problem and used to have a TiVo but Roku's "channel" term confused them. Eventually they called Netflix's icon a "library" and it was a bit easier to think of.

Our family has used an Amazon Fire Stick as a streaming player before, but it started to have a lot of issues so we decided to try something else. We love this Roku. It's so easy to use and set up. We can add all of our streaming apps on it. Because of that, we've gotten completely rid of cable. The remote is a little tricky at first, but we'll get the hang of it. A must-have in any home.

I like this product but had some activation problems. Some how this turned into a nightmare when I called the help number on the screen. They tried to charge me $69 to activate the unit. I didn’t fall for it and later found out it was a scam. Amazon and Roku should warn buyers of this product. Googling Roku scams, I found it could have been worse if I had given them my credit card number or let them take control of my computer. Finally got it to work. Amazon and Roku please do something about this. This is not a good way to treat your customers.
Gave one to each member of my family to introduce them to Roku and streaming, Its great device and easy way to get them into a streaming device at a low price

I did not appreciate trying to hook up the device, reading poorly written instructions and then finding out by going to the Roku website that I needed to pay 69.99 to actually activate and use the device( one -time fee). I was angry that on the website when buying , the product clearly states" No additional fees" so why am I being charged a fee to activate??? Not happy and I can not return because the window has closed on return. AMAZON really needs to monitor their products better so people don't get screwed.

We recently "cut the cord", dumped DirecTV, and got YouTube TV (along with our already existing Netflix, Hulu, and AmazonPrime). This works perfectly, although it is the "express". It is the lowest level of convenience.  There are not many features and the remote is bare bones, but it works well and does what it's supposed to.I am planning on getting a nicer, more "robust" Roku next, and probably keeping this as a "travel roku" for hotel room, AirBnB, etc., but if you are just testing the waters with cutting the cord, or just need something to watch Hulu and Netflix on, it's a great deal.
I bought this product in July. I have not had but headaches with it through out these past 3 months.1) #1 complaint - There is NO customer service, no one to HELP......

I’ve bought about 4 rokus prior to this purchase and I have loved them all. For some reason this one is just not up to their normal reputation. Constantly shuts off or reboots, stalls and runs incredibly slow. I know it’s not our internet because we only have issues with this particular Roku. Even if it’s the only thing running on our WiFi it will still run so incredibly slow or shut down that we just never use it or bring our other roku into the room. First time I’ve ever been disappointed with a purchase of this product.

I got a few of these devices, I m using to save on cable bill. It works great with the spectrum app! A word to the wise - I read a couple of reviews about an activation fee. I set two of these up today and there is no activation fee!! If you are being asked to pay a fee you are in the wrong place! Do not google the set up website - type in the address as it is when prompted on the screen and you will be fine.
PROBLEMS AFTER 6 MONTHS!! I SEE NO WAY TO CONTACT AMAZON ABOUT AN EXCHANGE. SUPPORT LASTS 6 MONTHS ON THIS ITEM.  NO WAY TO RETURN/EXCHANGE. MY PREVIOUS ROKUS LASTED MUCH MUCH LONGER.UPDATE!!!!

Works well.  Picture just as good as any other Roku, but the remote isn't very useful.  Even though this model is for a young child, it would have been nice to know up front that you can't control a TV.  My other two units had TV controls on the remote so I figured that was standard on all remotes.

I ordered this for my Mother. Her old Roku had stopped working, and she needed a new one. I saw this and thought why not try it out. Arrived on time and package was in good shape. Set-up was a breeze. It was nice to have the batteries included in the package. I like the fact that this is smaller. My Mother's old one had to be moved around on the TV stand, but this new express just sticks right on the bottom of the screen. I love it. Definitely a great purchase!

I was so excited when I received my Roku Express.  It  pretty much programmed itself almost.  I loved the display but never got the chance to use it.  You are "required" to enter your credit card information to activate the Roku and there's no exception.  It appears that your signing up for a trial period for ordering movies and applications.  I know that I would not be ordering movies and should be given the option to opt-out of its trial period.  I'm returning it and going to Amazon Fire Stick.

This thing is amazing, i set up xfinity but it only came with one xpress box, so I got this one for my room. This is easy to setup. For those who get the CC payment set up just scroll all the way down and click skip payment setup. It will take you to the starting screen. You don’t have to set up unless you want to subscribe to their channels. If you are using it for your own subscriptions like Netflix, Disney+ or Amazon Prime Video. Honestly love it! The picture quality is great and the remote is super easy to use. I like that they have the Disney+ button next to the Netflix one since they are my most ised apps.

This device is limited to the whim of all the service providers and I have found the experience of dealing with their restrictions pretty cumbersome. The device itself is nice, but usability through media can be improved. I hope they get a better selection.

I needed to replace a FireT V stick, but Amazon next-day delivery could only ship it in two weeks. My Prime membership was worthless in this situation. So, I ordered a Roku Express, and to my delight, it was much better than my FireTV stick. Picture quality is outstanding, and the ROKU channel has great content. I was also surprised that Amazon din't offer a price reduction for my shipping delay. In this case, it resulted in three soon-to-be discarded Fire TV sticks.

I purchased the roku device thinking that all I had to do was set it up. Pay for channels that were not free. When I tried to hook it up it keep saying failed. Call customer support. When I called and spoke to customer support someone they informed me of a “NEW ACTIVATION” fee. I had to  pay $89 for them to allow my roku to activate. After paying the fee it worked. Now as I look into roku requiring activation fees. I see all the reviews saying don’t pay the fee. DONT ORDER FROM THIS SCAM COMPANY ON AMAZON!!! I got scammed! Be aware!

I watched my kids with there Roku and seen how they were able to go from different streaming services and finally got it myself. It works great and I get connected fast. The only down side is that the TV portion goes through the internet and doesn't come in as clear. When I watch regular TV I just switch the HMDI over, no big deal, except my husband can't remember that most of the time. The Roku doesn't have the volume on it, no big deal. I guess the newer ones have it.

This device lacks a search function, so you have to scroll past hundreds of garbage channels (e.g. beer channel, buttcheek channel, boob channel, R-rated channel, etc) trying to find a good channel.  There is no way to delete all of those lame channels from the device.  Pushing the astrix button only deletes it from your home screen, not from the channel lists that any kid can easily click on and then inadvertently be exposed to channel icons with nudity, etc.We bought this brand new.  The first had Disney+ but had a software glitch, so Amazon sent a replacement.  The second one has no Disney+ (even after the software update) and no way to add it.

This Roku unit offers a lot for the price... the only drawback I have with it is that you can't change channels directly... so if you're using it with Spectrum TV, you have to scroll past hundreds of channels to get to the movie stations.  That said, there is a ton of channels you can select from and a lot of them are free.  Using the Roku app, you can control it from your phone, which is a nice addition.  It also offers access t most of the pay stations which of course, you have to subscribe to.

The headline says it all: if, like me, you took a chance and wiped your backside with $25 of your hard-earned cash by spending it on a Fire Stick which now spends more time resetting than streaming, then this Roku needs to be your next purchase. No dropped signals, no interruptions, nothing... just streaming, streaming, streaming. A product you paid good money for actually functioning as intended? Check. Cut your losses, stop letting your Fire Stick ruin your day at least once per hour, and get this thing. Now. You won't be sorry.

I was using fire stick before. I hate how it wants your “Amazon” PW for every little thing. Sorta felt like it was an invasion of my privacy. Why do they need to know everything I do? I don’t like Alexa either. Not since I heard she laughs for no reason but that supposedly has been corrected. Creepy. Don’t know if it’s true but a friend questioned if “they”could listen in. Again, Creepy. I gave that one to my sister & she loves it. I bought this roku & I love it! So glad I made the decision I did.

Put up with streaming from a Sony BluRay player for 3 years to our projector in media room. We bought this same Roku for our kitchen TV a few months ago and liked it so much we bought a second one for our main viewing location. It is 100 times better than the smart BD player for adding content and even ease of playing.Well worth the price and having both remotes the same helps with remembering where the buttons are at.

One of the reasons why I bought the Roku streaming player is to get rid of my expensive cable TV! Most of the time, we’re at work and school and we don’t really watch regular programming on cable except for news. I chose Roku because it had the most selections of streaming channels, plus, it has TFC (The Filipino Channel). The picture quality is great and the remote is easy to use. There are also a lot of free shows without any subscriptions. And even with subscriptions, it’s still cheaper than cable TV.

I honestly really like this product and it works great. What I dislike is that the remote must be pointed directly at the receiver (I mounted it on the side of TV) or it does not pick up signal. I tend to point at TV and most often does not pick up signal. When I aim at side it does. Little issue, but still an issue. The TV remote works if pointed in direction of, does not have to be pointed specifically at an area

This is a good device and the price can't be beat. The only minor annoyance, and why I knocked a star off, is that the remote is IR. So it needs line of site to the device. At this price point that is acceptable, but it does take away a bit of convenience, especially considering the included HDMI cable is only around 1 foot long. Overall I would definitely recommend with the caveat that you will need line of sight for the remote or use the Roku app.

We do have other Rocky devices in our home so we are very familiar with the product and how it functions however we’ve noticed this one is constantly buffering and freezing up and the picture quality is fuzzy even with HDMI wire. I’m wondering if this was a refurbished Roku or if it’s just not working properly. Extremely dissatisfied with this purchase and we literally just missed the window for return

SO SETUP DOES TAKE LONGER THAN WHAT I WAS EXPECTING( AROUND 5 MIN FOR SOMEONE EXPERIENCE IN TECH SOMEONE NOT AS EXPERIENCE..  GOOOOOOOD LUCK..) I GOT THIS FOR A FAMILY MEMBER SO EVEN IF IS NOT TO HARD TO USE THIS OH MAN! EXPLAINING THE "HOW TO'S" TO SOMEONE MUCH OLDER TOOK AROUND 4 HOURS..OVERALL IF THIS PRODUCT WAS FOR ME I WOULD GIVE IT 4 STARS BUT SINCE I GOT THIS FOR SOME1 OVER 50.. WELL NOT PLEASED WITH THE EXPERIENCE.

This Roku overheats and creates a picture that is unwatchable.  It has lines with the picture going out and skipping over parts of the show you are watching until it completely goes out.  I tried unplugging it when it wasn't in use, but that didn't even help.  I had to plug in my old Roku.  I got this Roku to mirror my phone, but that didn't work very well.  It's time for a smart TV with this stuff built in.  I would go with a bigger Roku model that would be less likely to overheat if I were you and avoid this model all together.

Easy to hook up!  (You will need a free HD port on your TV. Unit seems to prefer a dedicated port. I would not recommend running through a HD hub or through a AV Receiver.  Couldn't get that to work.)  Love the variety of streaming services!  If you have a good internet connection, this will be a great streaming device for you!  I have a ROKU in my living room, master bedroom, and Man Cave!
1. Unlike my previous Roku, my TiVo, my Apple TV, my DVD player, my receiver and my TV, NO ETHERNET.2. Unlike my previous Roku, my TiVo, and my Apple TV, the remote is IR. With no voice control. Ugh.

I love my rokus! I have one in each room that has a tv (even if they are smart tvs because roku is just so much faster and easier to use) I love that the remote has 4 buttons that connect to top streaming services too. Just so easy! So many awesome features too. (Apps, games, a way to connect your phone to your tv so you can watch things from your phone on the big screen) Highly recommend!

Just as Xfinity Staff have suggested to Me for Me to lower My huge bill, I thought it was too good to be true,but I set this up with as much info by web and youtube videos on how to install the Roku, and I get the channels like a dvr except I cant record and the roku remote dont have numbers to select channels on live tv, but otherwise its very good, may look to getting more in the future.

Super easy ‘install’ and set up! I was up and running in less than 20 minutes, logged into three of my subscribed streaming services, and watching a show! Regardless of what other reviewer‘s have noted, there is no reason to have to put in a credit card number. It is simply not required by the Roku. I have a feeling reviewers who have complained about this may have been being prompted by a subscription streaming service that they have that requires it.Only 30 minutes in, but it works as expected so far!

I cut the cord after too much frustration with my cable company.  Also got tired of paying as much in fees, surcharges, and taxes as for the service.  Have enjoyed free movies every night instead of surfing fruitlessly for something to watch.  Music station great!  Easy to  install, easy to use, small units take up little space.  Give wide variety of choices and freedom to customize to personal tastes.  Worth every penny.

Easy to install, easy to use, easy to sync if you have an existing Roku account.PLEASE NOTE: the remote that comes with this is only for the Roku device, it does not have TV control options. If that's what you're looking for, consider another option (another Roku option it what I mean). I'm not deducting any stars because I knew this, but some buyers might not think about it before buying.
We’ve only had the device a short time, but we love it. One of the main reasons for purchasing it was to stream BritBox. It was easy to set up, easy to add programs to, and easy to use.

I love Roku devices. I have 5. But beware when you go to set this up. You go online with a code from the device. I got an error message when I tried to finish set up that my account wasn't up to date. I called the number and was told it cost $50 to update the account. I fell for it. I've since canceled the credit card and got the money back. The scammers were able to set up my devices, so I don't understand what all happened.

I've had my Roku Express for a month and I'm absolutely thrilled. I cut the cable cord and got Hulu+Live TV and the picture comes in so clear, much better than cable or satellite ever did. I also have Disney+ and WWE Network and everything works great. I even bought my Mom a Roku Express and she loves it too. She finds it easy to use and she's not great with technology. This may be the greatest investment I've ever made and it's saved me a lot of money and hassle.

I love roku but I will warn anybody that is looking to get one not to buy this one unless you want to always have two remotes. This one will not be able to turn your TV on and off. This will not be able to turn the volume up and down on your TV. It would be better to get one of the others - the best way to tell is by looking to see if the power button is on the top of the remote or not.

We were able to install and use this so quickly. It was easy to install and set up. Would highly recommend if you don't have a smart TV or if you and still need other options for watching shows and movies. Would highly recommend.

I had a TV without cable or smart capabilities. The Roku fit the bill to allow guests to be able to watch something if they wanted. It was inexpensive, easy to install, and easy to navigate. May buy one for a second guest room.

I only replaced my old Roku because it was something like seven years old. I got a message THROUGH the Roku (or maybe by email) that my Roku would no longer be updated because it was just too old. That was fine because we had to reboot it a lot and it took forever. So I got this Roku and I love it. It was easy to set up, it is fast, it is familiar yet better. I might add that I ordered it on Friday evening and it arrived on Sunday.

Set it up and it worked fine. For some reason after a few months it would not accept password and would not allow a password reset or any sort of reset. Customer service number no longer works, chat has been discontinued and FAQ do not cover. I'm stuck with no access. Beware if you have a problem.

Don't do it I had to call to get it activated they wanted $50 to activate I told the kid on the phone no so he Sind me up for a dating web site now they text me daily I'm disabald so I can't change my phone number cause of doctor appointments and banking these roku guys are completely unethical it is buy or else with them I don't know how to get my phone number off that site so basically they did something to me they can't take back

Wish I’d gotten one of these years ago and replaced my old Apple TV sooner.I bought a Roku TV off amazon for my guest room last year and was very pleased with it, but wasn’t ready to replace my living room tv just yet. Fast forward a year and my old Apple TV is slowly doing away with the apps to encourage users to upgrade to the newer Apple TV. I decided I wasn’t ready to shell out $140 for a new Apple when I enjoyed the Roku experience and it was only $30!

Bought this to replace my outdated Roku that wouldnt allow me to add Disney Plus.  Wow!!!  What an amazing picture!!  They sure have come a long way!!  LoL.  Wish I would have updated sooner now!Set up was quick and easy and FREE!!!

I liked my old ROKO player until it broke.  I ordered the new one and I am sorry.  Now, it seems like I am always being asked to input my email address and passwords ( I finally escaped the sidetrails built into the device that tries to get you to sign up for EXPENSIVE services.  I quit this one; I may order a Firestick instead, but I will need to decide if it is worth the trouble.  YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

Note for all road warriors that the interface for connecting to hotel WiFi, while present, is clumsy and hit and miss. Appears it hasn't been updated in years. If you are considering this for your home, great! If you want to travel with it think again. It might connect to your hotel WiFi, it might not. Even if it does the process is the antithesis of user friendly, speaking as one with a masters in Information Technology who has had to resort to everything from MAC spoofing from another device and on to try and bridge the Roku shortcomings in this regard.

I bought this to replace an outdated Roku.  I was worried about losing all of the channels I had but the setup was quick and simple.  Best of all, my channels carried over.  I'm buying another one for sure.  It's small and compact, works with all of the Roku remotes (that don't require a pairing button).  If your on the fence about what to get for a streaming media player, go with Roku you won't be disappointed!

Pros - So, so easy to use!  I plugged it into my TV hdmi port and logged in and everything was there.  The TV I have is a great TV but it didn't have all my options available I needed, like access to my Disney+ account and more.  Now, I turn on my Roku and I can get to all my subscription channels and lots of other free channels I didn't even know existed!Cons - none so far for me.

I'm a senior citizen and very technology challenged - it took a bit of getting used to but I like the Roku and the ability to access links to just about all the TV shows I like at a fraction of what I was paying in cable fees.  Good reception - I don't understand how it works or why but I like it!

I got this because I wanted to stream Disney plus and couldn't download it on my tv. I don't use the apps on my tv anymore. I haven't had any issues with it. It loads quickly and works well, even with my rural slow internet. I took it with to a hotel, and it worked well there. At a hotel, it uses your phone or computer to connect to the hotel wifi, but I didn't have a problem setting it up. I would recommend.

Only reason for 3 stars is because for some reason this thing will not adjust to my mom's TV screen. For some reason it only displays a tiny little screen on the top left corner of the screen. Yes, I messed with both display ratios and no my moms TV is not a smart TV (obviously otherwise i would not need this) but her TV is not outdated either. It is a flat screen LCD with HDMI compatibility. If it makes any difference, it is a Sansui flat screen TV. The roku stick adjusts to every other TV in the house except the one in moms room, bummer she got this in her Christmas stocking and she cant use it :/

It really is a great product. Easy to use and setup.  A lot of channels that you can subscribe to as well.  That being said when you subscribe to HBO now through Roku for instance don't accidentally resubscribe through the HBO now app on another one of your tv's which is inadvertently what happened to me.  You not only get double billed but also have to cancel each individual subscription through either Roku and or HBO now or both altogether.

Unbelievable. So, if you already own a Roku and you're on a "basic" plan, whatever that is, if you buy another Roku before you can activate it you have to pay $100 for 3 years of premium service or $149 for a lifetime premium service. I am returning this and will buy a firestick.
Love that it has a Beta Xfinity app. As long as you have one xfinity box in the house, you can connect a Roku to any other TV and watch all the xfinity channels and your recorded shows.
A little bit better than it’s predecessor the 2015 model. I bought the new one so I could run pure flix.

The Roku express is a simple device that is easily attached to your plat Screen monitor. And for under $30 bucks you're getting premium shows in the best quality in HD. I really enjoyed watching my favorite tv shows and movies when and how i want to which is very cool.The Roku express puts you in control of what shows you choose to watch without having to pay for expensive tv programing that does'nt meet your needs. You'll have access to many shows which are free to see and some that requires access to Cable to get but overall you're get more bang for the buck..It's a Great product.

All in all a great product with one exception ...I think they over simplified the remote ... I wish it had a few more buttons such for volume control, and TV power..  I know these are available on the Roku Ultra but I think they could have included them in this for not much more cost.

This device is constantly pausing the video due to buffering issues. My internet speeds are more than sufficient for streaming video services and all of my other devices (Apple TV, TV, mobile devices...) are able to stream the same content on the same internet connection with no issues.  Roku does not provide agent assisted support for this issue and/or model.The only reason this device has not been thrown away is the ability to search multiple subscriptions at once for streaming content.

While it was able to find my wireless network, it never got to the screen asking me for my user name and password.  I restarted it countless times and even reset my router.  I tried to look for customer support and all I found were FAQ sections full of people with the same issue and no answer.  Roku customer support repeatedly said it was unavailable for this type of product.  Infuriating.

I recently purchased this product to find an alternative to paying a monthly fee for another cable box on my plan. I was pleasantly surprised upon using this great product. It not only serves as an alternative to another cable box, but allows me to watch my favorite streaming apps on a big screen without paying top dollar for a new smart tv altogether. The Roku channel library is a plentiful treasure trove of streaming mediums and other channels that I can watch with the help of my cable tv subscription. The only downside to this product is that some of the more well known and popular Roku  channels require your cable tv account information. Additionally, seldom is live tv available on this product. Other than this, this product is very useful to the movie lovers among us who long to watch their movies on streaming services on a big screen without leaving the sanctity of their home.

Roku is the best.  Remote is the best.  Speed is good.  Picture is good.  I have a air play mini by Apple, a Firestick, a smart tv, and a Roku.  4 tv's in all.  The smart tv is the best.  The 3 streaming devices in order #1 Roku, #2 Firestick, #3 air mini.  The air mini would have been a clear #1 choice except it cannot run certain apps that all the others can such as Hulu... ugh.

This works great for streaming my Netflix....but don't get fooled into paying an activation fee.  The first couple of websites I went to I was asked to pay a one time activation fee of $89.00.  The second site I went to I was also asked to pay an activation fee.  These websites are scams.  Make sure you use the official Rocu site.  It was a breeze to set up after that and works great.

The operating system loads fast and the remote control is responsive. You are able to turn off the tv from the roku home screen without using the main TV's remote controller but could be more streamlined by providing a power button on the roku controller instead of clicking a couple time to do the job. It has youtube which is great because my Samsung TV's smart hub doesnt provide it as it is an older model.

This unit is a piece of junk.  I have bought and tried two of these - in both cases, I set the unit up exactly per the instructions and followed the prompts to connect the unit to my Wi-fi - no problems so far.  Then, the unit downloaded and installed updates to its software, and an on-screen message tells me it will reboot after it is finished, which it does.  After it reboots, the bouncing Roku logo appears on screen, and that's as far as it goes.  I tried all of the fixes recommended online, including rebooting, resetting, etc., and it always came back to the bouncing Roku logo on screen.  Looking online, a lot of other people are finding themselves in exactly the same situation, and the only recommendations that are offered are to try rebooting and resetting, and then exchanging.  I exchanged once.  I'm not going to waste my time with it anymore.

The Roku Express HD seems to work ok for streaming Youtube TV, but the remote has fewer features than the remote supplied with the Roku Ultra device. It doesn't have a power button to turn the TV off or on, so you'll need to use the TV remote. It also doesn't have volume buttons, a mute button, and the headphones jack that are on the Ultra remote. They do keep the Netflix, ESPN, Hulu, and Sling buttons on the bottom of the remote.

Just as the review states, the remote does not have a power button like their other models. So you cannot turn off the TV using the ROKU remote. I bought this for a guest room tv with the idea that one remote would do all the work. Now I need to use the an additional remote to turn off the TV. The remote does turn on the TV by using the home key. It is a simple thing but very frustrating.

Would of gave it a 5 but I liked the Fire Stick better w/ Alexa way better but my Internet provider told me that I had to buy this type instead. I’m a bit upset with Xfinity because I gave my Fire Stick as a present because I bought a Smart TV and didn’t need it anymore. They said its working great w/ Internet, wish I new that before I got the Roku stick.

I finally thought I'd try to buy one of these for everyone to try.  I set up two of these successfully and I still enjoy using a VCR, so anyone can figure out the set-up.  However, I did not know I would need to add a credit card in the process, but I think it was only in case you want to purchase different subscriptions. Overall, I everyone enjoys the new Rokus and getting free stations can push us toward getting rid of cable. So glad I purchased these! A++

I had to buy one of these since Spectrum. TV does not support Gen 3 Apple TV or Amazon Firestick. This is just for a spare bedroom. Set up was a pain and having to give a credit card is absurd. Changing channels is a pain since you can only scroll up or down. Who designed this thing? Other than that is works ok but I would never use this as my primary way to wTch TV

I bought this for my mother, and paired it with Amazon Prime Video/Britbox. I usually stream through one of my consoles, but my mom doesn't have any other way to stream. She loves British shows, and the accessibility to Prime Video and YouTube is also great. Picture is great, set up was easy, and the interface, though a little daunting at first, is easy to navigate after getting used to it.

I used to have an Amazon Fire Stick which needed to be reset every 2 or 3 hours (very annoying). Roku is easy to use and doesn't have to be reset all the time. The price was right. The only thing I don't like is that if you pause a TV show with multiple episodes it bumps you up to the next episode and won't let you go back to the unfinished episode. Otherwise, it's great.

I had a Roku stick from years back. It was awesome; you just had to plug it in, and you were good to go. Now you have to add a payment option, set up an account, go thru a lengthy "adding channels" process. I've already paid for the device; I don't need you data mining me as well. No, I don't want to set up an account to use your device; no, I don't want to be forced to add a payment option; I'll give you my CC info when I want to buy something. They took a good product and ruined it. I wish I could give zero stars.

Works seamlessly with my WIFI and not smart TV.  I didn't want to be stuck with Apple versus Amazon versus Google so I got the best of all worlds; Roku.  My TV provided enough power through the USB port so I did not have to use the provided USB power block that looks like every power block that charged my cell phones over the years.  Remote is IR and this Roku option did not control my TV but no big deal.

I love it! It is very easy to use , install and manage.. So many options, thinking about cancelling cable and just using this! Well see - You won't be disappointed. It asked you for a credit card but that is just for PREMIUM Channels.. Everything else is FREE.. If you have a Netflix acccount, Amazon Prime Video  , HULU, etc... All you have to do is Log in!  I'm so very happy with my purchase that I purchased  another one for my Daughters room.. :-)

Been trying to get support from Roku for 20 minutes. Their website does not allow you to contact them. They only list articles or community answers. When I choose to contact them it literally goes in a circle and starts back over the beginning of the support questions. As Hulu is playing the video will freeze and the sound will keep going.This happens about once every 15 minutes so it’s quite annoyingFor a brand new purchased item.

It suspect it's simply not compatible with my TV.  There's no one live to talk or chat with, therefore I had to search through countless Community discussion questions.  When I'd find a possible "solution" it'd have an email for the original post-er to contact, yet it would not work for me .My last decide was great.  I'm disappointed I'll probably have to buy a more expensive model.

Necesitaba algo sencillo pero que resolviera el problema de convertir una tv simple en Smart y con este aparato me resolvió bastante ya que aparte que me convierte la tv en Smart y puedo ver netflix me resuelve el problema de los cables ya que no necesita tantos cables para funcionar.

This was my second purchase for bedroom tv which is an older Sharp Aquos HDTV. The major issue is audio, whenever commercials play, the audio becomes distorted and out of sync. After some suggested workarounds by other users having same issue, none fixed the issue permanently. I decided that after receiving a replacement and issue was still in effect from previous unit, I went back to my Apple TV and have no problems currently. I’m not knocking on Roku, however they are aware of this concern but in no hurry to fix it.

I tried to use this item which does not have direct internet capability and must use wireless.  My router is 18 feet on another floor from the Roku, but that was too far, the streaming continued to fail.  I talked to customer service who told me it had to be no farther than 15 feet to work, so I spent another $45 to get a booster, that helped little, but not satisfactory.  I thrown it away and went back to Amazon Fire Stick

I bought this to replace a ROKU2 that was no longer allowing me to stream Hulu content.  I really don't like the new format associated with this device and the remote is glitchy, moving 2-3 times instead of once.  Worse yet, they fixed the problem with ROKU2 and I don't even need this.  Great that they solved the problem,  sad that I bought this while they were doing it.

Our old smart TV is losing app updates, so I bought this to keep watching Netflix, basically. It works just fine for that. Good picture quality and easy to use through the many screens and apps. If you get this, look up Pluto TV. I'm watching it more than Netflix and it's free.Edit: Bought a second one locally for another (dumb) TV and it works just as well.

I just recently got rid of my cable box and switched over to using the Rokus to watch tv. It is simple and very easy to use. My nephew who is 4 can work the roku, as well as my not so tech handy mom. Great product for a great price.

It wouldn't connect to the wireless network.  There are no ethernet ports.  Everything was OK with the network (phone and laptop had no problem connecting).  Since it wouldn't connect to the network we were locked out of getting into any of the other set up options.  Web support through roku.com was useless.

I don't understand having to get Roku account and the hook up is  very confusing. I have not hook it up. I am not sure about roku  feeding control. The first roku I got was easy to hook up and i am still using it after 10 years. So I guess I will not mess with the new express. I am not happy with roku new policy of forcing me to get a account with them!! Free or not!!  Nothing is really free is it?

I had a ROKU stick installed, but was having problems with interference from some other electronics in the house, so when I ordered this I was worried it might do the same. The unit attached to the side of my TV and is in a direct line to the remote. It was easy to set up and is easy to use. No problems at all with it since I received it.

Oh man. I can't believe it took me so long to get a Roku. It streams my Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, and Disney+ on any TV and it's so easy to set up. I move a lot and I take it with me wherever I go. It's just so nice to be able to 1) watch things on a big screen and 2) do work on my laptop while I watch things. Just get one!!

I had to set up a Roku account in order to use it. It was free and easy to set up. I purchased this just to watch UFC on ESPN+ and now I'm using it as my main entertainment hub. I like that I have all my entertainment apps in one place and it's fairly easy to connect my cable subscription channels to stream. I think for the price, size, and streaming quality it is a good purchase.

I have been using Youtube TV for about a year with no issues. I just purchased this and the app locks up about once a day (I watch about 2 hours a day) and I have to close the app and reopen it to get it to work.

If you're used to using Roku with remotes that don't require line of sight, don't order this.  The remote requires line of sight.  That means you have to wrestle your arm out from under the covers and point it directly at the device.  What a pain.  On the other hand you wouldn't have to... I mean it's cheap and it works.

I used to ignore Roku device for some time by using chromecast and playstation to stream my desired media, but decided to give it a try and wish I did that long time ago,Not only you can watch you own collection by adding Plex server but all local channels, news, all my subscribed (Netflix, Prime video) all in one spot, not need to hassle with where is that Netflix app or Hulu on my iphone and plenty of other channels, and new channels i am not even aware of still there for me to explore!
Works well and make your older TV work like a SmartTV.

The Roku Express has lived up to the hype. As a person who streams a LOT more than watching broadcast TV, I can now easily switch between streaming services like Amazon Prime, Netflix, YouTube, etc. The only con I can mention is the lack of a power switch on the device itself which means I have to pull the power plug after each use.

I purchased this to replace my old Roku 2 since most of the Apps (Hulu, Netflix, etc.) would no longer be compatible with my Roku 2. This is a great and efficient replacement, response time is quick, no major buffering, and the interface is a lot cleaner and easier to read/navigate compared to the old Roku. I just miss the ability to play games and plug my headphones into the stick like on my old ones. Otherwise, it’s a good, affordable replacement.

my old, very very very used Roku 2 was finally giving up the ghost. its been with me for years and has been properly used. Decided to upgrade to the Express model because that price is awesome and cannot recommend enough. very smooth interface, easy set-up, and all around a good decision. If you are needing a upgrade, I highly suggest!

I may have received a bad product, but certain streaming services (Netflix, hulu) often get hung up and freeze. I bought this to expand my options, so I already have those 2 services on my TV, and they work fine on there. Still think this is a great device to expand your streaming options, especially if you have an older smart TV, like I do!

This was the first time I tried the one with the little box as I had bought the stick in the past for another tv. I like that it came with a thing to stick the little box down cause it was making me crazy flopping all over the place when I was installing it. I wish it had the updated remote with the volume and mute controls on it though.

I love it so far. The unboxing and setting up was very easy. The directions were clear and simple to follow. Everything is small, lightweight, easy to assemble and connect. The price of the device made it a no brainer that this is the way for me to go. I’ve purchased and installed a device on each television in my home and completely ditched my cable service.

We already had one prior to purchasing this. I love roku. The basic one is good enough for us. Recently, I had purchased cheap, used, non-smart TVs for my childrens' rooms and then got them all the basic roku to make them smart. They are elated. They are easy to use and set up and the remotes are super simple amd user friendly.

All I wanted was a device to allow me to cast from my phone to the tv. This was advertised as being able to do that with no restrictions listed.The first problem was needing to enter a credit card when registering. I don't plan on buying anything, so I shouldn't need any payment info. Luckily, I found a method online that shows how to get around that.

After about a month of successful use the plug which supplies power failed. After trying many other things to fix the problem I finally determined the plug which  goes in the wall failed. I replaced it with an extra from my cell phone - never had one of these with any device fail.Nothing wrong with the remote but was the closest category for stars above

We bought the Roku Express to replace our old 1st gen Roku SD. Setup took a while, but once it was done, we got a great modern Roku experience with the HD picture to match our TV. The only real downside of the unit is that it's so tiny, you need to tape it into place using the provided adhesive.  It amazes me how cheap, small, and energy-efficient set-top streaming technology has become.

There seems to be a probable with Roku company.  It is unclear if the company has  this problem or if someone "high jacked the site.  Tried to set it up be it said it failed and indicated that I need to call "this number" . Called this number and the person said that the policy has changed so to finish the install you have to pay $99.00 more..

The Roku is a lot of fun, its actually a great product. But there are a few things I want you to know as a potential buyer, you may already infer these things on your own but in-case you don't im here to tell you.The item is good, the interface is also good, its fast to respond, but my issues with it, granted there are very few , but they are some odd ones, mainly the fact that it doesn't come with a longer enough HDMI Cable to even reach most HDMI Ports, the cable may be about a foot long, to it is very short.  And the other issue I have with this product is there doesn't seem to be a way to actually "Power Off" The roku its self via the remote or otherwise.

I have been a loyal Roku owner for a long time and had high expectations for this device, thus I was extremely disappointed in the poor performance of this product.  It never connected to my internet signal and I attempted to troubleshoot the issue, according to Roku's instructions, several times with no success.  This is my first time of ever being disappointed in Roku.

Awesome little box to centralize your streaming media content. Purchased because our older TVs aren't able to get the Disney+ App via the native TV shop. Even the Samsung TV that should be able to get it can't. So Roku it was. It's such an easy User Interface that my 5 + 8 year old children are able to competently operate the remote and navigate to what they wish to watch.

Incredibly easy to set up and use. I set it up on my own and was able to use within the first five minutes. Hooked it up to a projector and it has been great. I even downloaded the remote for extra convenience. I truly prefer this over my Apple TV. Bought this originally for my kids room a year or two ago and loved it enough to buy two more in the long term and ditched my Apple TV.

I use Roku to put different programs on tv, and at my convenience so I’m free to pause a program if I like it but don’t want to watch the whole thing at once. Today’s box is much smaller than the one I replaced. Setup was quite easy and the internet is now fast enough that I don’t worry at all about freeze ups that used to affect vcr’s. Batteries are even included.

Purchased the Roku Express in mid-February. Right after my return date I started having issues with Hulu. I could not find a fix so headed to the Roku forum for some help. There is a now a thread with 26 pages with people having the same issue for months with very little support from Roku. They have responded to this problem "once" in all this time. Most people who are having this issue seem to be on the Express model. If you subscribe to Hulu you're much better off using another interface.

I was able to figure out the use of the device without any clear instructions.  My key purpose was to use the Spectrum App to access my local cable channels and not have to pay an additional  $6.99 a month for a cable box. I am already paying for 2 receivers and DVRs from Spectrum and have their  cable service.  The Roku would allow me to receive about half my paid Spectrum channels but not the other half, the half that contained many of the local channels.  Roku provides no customer support except via the Internet and that is poor.  Spectrum was good and tried for half an hour to solve the problem but could not.  An Amazon rep tried to resolve and answer my questions but failed and so now I am returning the Roku.  Very poor service from Roku.  I would have been satisfied if the Roku had delivered my one local channel.
Not working.showed the roku bouncing icon. connected to my network. and then nothing.Customer service phone number is a joke.

Ease of install. We have 5 year old tv at our second home that is not a smart tv and wanted to watch roku,prime, hdtv etc so we ordered one for there.  Wish the remote had a volume control on it like our other unit. Looks nice installed. Cable is JUST long enough to plug in. Good value. We should have bought one sooner, love it.

This thing is awesome! Plugs into hdmi slot and another cord into the wall it comes with everything you need all the cords even batteries for the remote! Cute little remote easy to use!! And Roku has a channel!!!

Easy to set up, easy to navigate and use. Lots of free content to explore as well as other choices. Surprised it did not have the HBO Max app. I hope they add it. The included HDMI cable and the power cord are extremely short. Too short for my original plan but I was able to improvise at the base of the TV and it seems to work fine.

Under $30 to buy and I get many free channels over the house wifi.  I have one in the den, one in the bedroom.  Great way to get Prime and YouTube videos on the big screen and theater system with no monthly fees.  Subscribe to YouTube TV and get a slew of cable and sports channels...news, sports, kids, educational and movie channels for $49.99 a month...much cheaper than cable.  This device makes it happen.

Do not buy this piece of junk!!!  Will not launch Prime Video app...  Worked for about a week.  Tried re-installing, re-booting, refreshing network & internet connection.  Even did a factory re-set on the device (which was a total pain)....... nothing!!!!  Stick with a FireStick for sure.

Update to my previous review below- now the device does not turn on at all. I have checked all plugs, tried different outlets etc. So now we have no access to our streaming services and are forced to purchase another device. What a waste of money. DO NOT BUY!We have had this Roku for 2-1/2 months, about a month and a half into owning it we began to have issues.  It will randomly shut off while in use or it will not turn on unless we unplug it and plug it back in again.  We have tried multiple ports on our TV to be sure it was not a plug issue and still no resolve.  It is unfortunate we started having issues right after the allowable return date.  All of our other Roku devices we have been happy with.  This is very disappointing.

I ordered the Roku stick because my Samsung has very limited choices for streaming, and I wanted to increase the choices. A great surprise was discovering the stick turns on my TV when I press the home button. I got this model to save some money, otherwise I would have gotten one that had volume control.  I am super happy with it and would recommend it to anyone. Well worth it.

Once you set it up it goes to a menu. I have Spectrum & can just click on it & get all of my spectrum channels. Plus what ever Roku has to offer. To connect a tv with spectrum it cost $8.00/mo. With Roku it's $30.00 & never pay anything else!. The first one I bought had something wrong but Amazon replaced it no charge. Amazon & Roku are Great!!

I had been streaming Netflix & amazon prime on my"smart dvd" player. This Roku proves my DVD player was not so smart & definitely not keeping up with streaming speeds. Instantly logs into Netflix. Enjoying the free Roku station & their offering. (With commercials but hey it's free!)  Downloaded the Roku app to make logging in to subscriptions easy. Love the "private" listening option thru my phone via the free app too. Only downside? No tv volume control on this remote like the older version.

We had a Roku tv in our room and it was awesome and super easy to use. We got a new TCL smart tv and found out quickly that we were not able to download certain apps like FXNOW or HBOGO. So we tried using the fire stick- picture quality was awful. I just Kept thinking - i just Want me Roku back! So I got this and my Roku account saved all my apps! It was so easy to use and I’m no longer frustrated with being limited. The only critique i would Say is that the rubber buttons on the remote are not as easy to use as the plastic buttons on other remotes.

If your in the United States, then disregard the following.First off, Roku has its own set of region-locked channels built-in. So even if you IP is whitelisted for a particular channel through your ISP; Roku will still block access.

OMG, Roku where have you been all my life?  I have been streaming Netflix through my old WiFi DVD player for years.  When Disney+ would not come through there, I tried Chromecast, but then my phone was tied up all night.  My son said he bought this Roku and it works great.  I bought it, got it up and running easy-peasy and voila, I can stream my Netflix shows, Hallmark movies and Disney+  all with the push of a button.  I just bought one for my daughter to use in her new apartment.  They have internet but can't afford cable just yet.  Highly recommended.

I'm a huge fan of Roku devices and I'm slowly replacing all the AppleTVs in my house (can't stand the Gen4 remote!!).  I have a previous ultra that has a bluetooth remote (don't have to point it at the device) and has a built in mic for saying what you're searching for instead of typing it out.  Other than that I love the interface and the picture and sound.

I apologize for reviewing an item I haven't used, but one of the main reasons I bought this thing was the image showing the remote with a Disney+ shortcut button. I have only Smart TVs but no access to Disney+ app. I'm confident I can get the app with Roku, but I can get it with a fire stick too.  The button sealed the deal. It's actually ESPN, so that's false advertising.

it connected fine right out of the box but within 10 minutes it dropped the wifi and would not reconnect no matter what I did, whether it be resetting the roku device or the router.  my other roku devices work fine with no problem.  looking to return this device.  Stick with the older models.This one doesn't even have volume control or voice.  garbage!

Everything works!  For this price point, I was expecting some hokey stuff trying to pair it with my TV or tablet, but it all worked the first time.  I was quite surprised.  I did not mount it to my TV, just let it sit on the table.One thing that could improve it would be volume control on the Roku remote.  This model does not come with it.

I’m very bummed out and will be returning this Roku stick.  I already have one stick in my house and bought a second one for my bedroom.  Was unable to set it up. Roku said my account was basic, and the only way to add a second device is to upgrade and pay a $69 one-time fee for the next level of service.  And even more if I wanted to add even more devices.  I wish I knew this.

I went with Roku (vs Amazon firestick) because of price, but I have always been a firestick user. The Roku works amazing and I was able to download the prime app on there and still access all of my Amazon Prime videos. It was speedy, easy to install, and works great. I may be a Roku user for life now!! Highly recommend!!

I have had an older Roku stick for years, did the job but seemed to be slowing down.  This new version is right on point, responsive and has loads of apps available.  Setup was really easy and it will even pre-load some channels for you.  It might be just me but it seems as though the buffering I had suffered with in the past has gone away!  Wish I got this sooner

I got this to replace my first Roku, which is no longer being updated. This is my third Roku. This one doesn't have the volume control buttons or the button to power the TV off and on. Those were great features, I wish they'd bring them back. Otherwise it's your standard great Roku! I threaded a long ribbon through the Roku tag so it's easier to find when it slides between the cushions.

I like it as much as the other roku devices. Its clearly not as good as the ultra, but if you dont have a 4k tv that doesn't really matter.I use this for TVs that are in other rooms. My main TV uses the roku Ultra. The remote is the basic version so no volume control or tv power button.

This is a great buy and great product. However, the hdmi is useless. It cannot be used as it doesn’t reach from the TV to the roku. I purchased two rokus and neither hdmi cables were long enough to be used. If you buy the express, plan on using another hdmi cable as the one included is useless as it is very very very short.

I’m not sure what the reason is, but I have plugged this Roku device that I received into multiple televisions and after a while (maybe an hour at most) the sound starts to glitch into the most ear piercing, robotic noise. I thought it was my sound bar, but like I said I have tried plugging it in to different TV’s. The sound is only “fixed” by removing the HDMI that the roku device is connected to from the TV for about 30 seconds. It’s wild. I normally fall asleep to the tv or have it running in the background for my pets, but the sound makes my pets leave the room too. LOL.
Needed another  Roku for the living room tv. Couldn't deal with that dang fire stick.  It kept omitting and they burn out quickly. Roku is easier to setup and doesn't  omitt signals while I stream.

So I purchased this hoping it would allow us to watch movies and listen to music without having to purchase a Roku television. Frankly it’s terrible. It doesn’t stream well even with the “excellent” internet connection I have. It’s gotten worse in the last month. I’m currently out of the return window but I’d recommend NOT getting this hook up. It doesn’t work well, doesn’t stream smoothly.

Works great, but would love it more if there was a direct button for YOUTUBE, as there is on the remote for NETFLIX, ESPN, HULU and SLING.In retrospect, I would have bought the version with the voice command remote, to save the tedious arrows to spell out searches.

Not exactly what I was looking for but I'll keep it.  Great for it's intended purpose.  Saying Goodbye to Amazon tho!!  Ordered this on Nov 5th n it arrived on the 13th!  Got order placed with Walmart same day n it arrived on the 7th.  Bye bye bye Amazon!!!  So sorry I bought this.  It keeps losing connection.  Very highly DO NOT recommend this!!!

I own an Apple TV Generation 4, which has been great, but it was given to me as z gift, and you can't add channels. I bought the Roku for access to Disney÷, but my gosh, the value for the cost is unbelievable! Great streaming quality, and the ability to add whatever channels you choose. It's a great device. Best $25 I ever spent.

I have 2 for my house then purchased this as a gift for my inlaws. They enjoy it. I especially enjoy the free channels from Pluto and Roku. However there are so many channels and not enough time in a day to see them all.  You can download YouTube and other apps to view free tv.  You just need internet.  I recommend this product.

It's awesome and everything they said it would be. Also it didn't stop with the purchase of the Roku trying to set it up I have to go register it online I go to register it online gives me an error code where I have to call and talk to telemarketers who then tells me I must pay him $149 to activate this. The whole reason I bought this voice stop with all the extra fees and as soon as I bought it tried to set it up and sit down and watch a movie with my family I found out I couldn't without an additional cost this made me very unhappy they don't bother to tell you that in the description!

I am in these process of getting rid of my cable and this was recommended by several people that I know.  The set up was easy and didn't take long at all.  I didn't like the option of having to put my credit card in but nowadays it seems to be a thing with any electronic. I loved that I can watch all the shows that I would normally watch on regular cable the only difference is that I'm not paying for it. I also like that I can use my Netflix, Hulu, and other apps that I have on tune device as well.

It’s a roku, can’t complain. Does exactly what i expected. Only complaint I have is that under network settings the 5G version of my WiFi won’t come up. Never have I ever thought that something like that would happen. Now I am stuck NOT using my fastest internet on my main television.

I spent a long time writing a review for the premiere unit. This time I will be brief.Don't buy any of these they are blind, deaf and dumb. Why don't you add a hard RJ45 network connection so I can actually use these. Shame on you ROKU. I am not sure where to turn next. The only thing I have that works is a Chrome Cast unit.

I already have a FireStick & a ChromeCast, but thought about trying the Roku for my 3rd TV. I was disappointed the moment I was forced to share my credit card info & there was no way around it. I am already paying for several online streaming services, so the Roku doesn't work for me. I have decided to return it.

This will most likely be the last roku I purchase.  Smart tv's are quite a bundant at the moment and cheaper so I see no point in continuing to buy adaptive devices like this.  If you have a great tv but it's not a smart tv, then this is the way to go.  If you have a few extra dollars, I would go with buying a smart tv and move away from separate devices (it just adds one more remote control to the pile that already probably have).

I use this in a van to watch tv. Tip for you guys. I don't have unlimited hotspot so what I do is download shows for offline viewing and cast to the roku without wifi on. Using the screen mirroring function on my tablet I connect to the roku and it'll show a prompt stating there is no wifi connection...select proceed anyways and you can cast your favorite shows! Hope this helps...

There is no customer support.  I cannot figure out how to integrate the ROKU into the rest of my services without going thru a series of adjustments every time I want to watch something on ROKU.  I cannot ad my other services to ROKU without being charged a monthly fee from ROKU.  I am tempted to throw it out.

The roku express HD streaming media player is so easy  to set up. I was amazed on how user friendly  it is. It came on time and had it up and running  within just a few minutes of it being dropped  off at my home. This is the second one. It just stopped working but we do use it ALOT. I do now think it was problems with the remote I am going to get a new remote and have two working rokus.

We had an old Roku that was in the list of ones they are ending service too, and we just signed up for Disney+, so this was a VERY affordable way to be able to do both at the same time (upgrading and being able to stream Disney Plus).We've really liked our old Roku and imagine this one will be even better.

Got this Roku player to replace an older model that stopped working. It’s a powerful little gadget and way better than what we had. The remote even offers voice control but I’d rather not. It was easy to set up and we’re back to enjoying streaming our favorite shows. The price was very reasonable too.

I got my first Roku Device 6 months ago and fell in love with them. The buffering you see from smart TV'S or other devices you wont see with Roku Streaming Devices. I plan to out a Roku in every room in my house as nd I highly recommend this product if you like streaming movies from Netflix, Hulu ect...

Bought this for our vacation condo, it's flawless with Plex and other local network accessed media. The problem comes when your internet stability maybe isn't the best... the Roku will glitch, stutter, and get stuck requiring a reboot if you don't want to wait 5 or so minutes for a timeout. App and menu surfing seems to drag a bit too,  I wouldn't recommend this unless you're only playing stuff from your local network media server.

Easy to set up.  If you have already subscribed to TV via cable and/or streaming options, this Roku consolidates all your streaming options.  Also, it is a great value and a competitive offer when one compares it to other options available.  Allows Live streaming of major networks.  Pleased. Very Pleased!
It doesn't have Volume Control but easy to use and install. I needed something for my small TV to watch while lounging on the porch

I am very disappointed with my Roku Express. Honestly if you can spare a few more buck, go for one of the other pricier options like the Roku Premiere (at least I am assuming that it is better than this) if not just go with an Amazon Product. The Fire TV Sticks that we have are way better than this. Don't waste your money.

I was a little hesitate to purchase this Roku based on the mixed reviews. I do wish the hdmi and usb cords were longer. Setup was easy enough and I was able to bypass the screen asking for payment info my just going to my account during the signup process on my phone

Decided to cancel our cable and replace it with Roku. Worst mistake ever. Went through the hassle of setting it all up and it won't link to our account so there is no service. Wasted $30 and an hour of our time (after an exhausting day) for nothing. Oh well …live and learn. Calling the cable company back tomorrow .

I bought this so my senior parents could hook it up to their tv and watch old TV game shows from my Sling account. They are in their 60’s and not tech savvy at all. They set it up themselves in no time at all! It’s as simple as plug and (add i your account info) and play! My pro tip would be to sign up for a roku account while you’re waiting to get yours in the mail. It’ll speed things up once you get it plugged in 🙂

My daughter got an update on her old Roku on YouTube  and  it shuts down in 5- 20 minutes.I bought this Express and my daughter set it up and it works .She loves Pluto TV and Youtube.She is happy.Good company and works great with my Wi Fi  and I have Comcast for this internet.😀

Allows streaming video content in an easy to use format. You can use your cell phone as a remote (although the keyboard function doesn't work right on my Android phone; everything else works great). Connect to Amazon Prime for free movies and shows as well as Netflix and many other streaming services. Great for the price!
Very satisfied with Roku Express.  Highly Recommend.  Does not have volume control.  Better than Fire Stick which I also have in many respects.

I am so glad I purchased This ROKU Express HD Streaming. I have a Samsung smart TV and  I do Not experience the Buffering anymore. I have not had any Problems . I have a Disclaimer. I am not getting paid nor a discount for this product. It works well With VUDU streaming and other NetWorks. :) Hope this helps.

Rokus are awesome. This is the second one I’ve purchased for my home. It made it easy to pull the plug on cable and switch just to streaming platforms. We mostly use it for Hulu, Netflix, and Amazon Prime Video. There’s SO much you can do with a Roku though, and it is definitely user friendly and easy to figure out.

Set this up and had no CC on Prime Video. All the other channels okay. I can play some of my Prime movies on another channel, with Movies Anywhere, and have CC. I even have CC on my  Prime shows on  my Kindle tablet, just not on my TV on the Roku Prime Video channel. I spent all day with Roku and Amazon customer support and they couldn't fix it either. Anyone have any ideas?Update: An Amazon tech and I finally figured out the CC secret. Very pleased with the Express now.

I absolutely adore my Roku and consider it to be one of the best purchases I have ever made! Extremely easy and fast to set up to the TV, add channels and use! I highly recommend this for anyone who enjoys watching streaming services and YouTube! I love getting to watch them all on my TV now instead of phone or laptop!
Not much to say other than it was easy to install and does what it's supposed to. Definitely cheaper than having to buy a new smart TV.

Purchasing this Roku was the best thing I have purchased in ages. It was easy to set up and works great. I am amazed at all that we can watch with this. Enabled us to return a cable box and saves us a monthly fee. The Roku paid for itself quickly. We are considering buying more for our other TVs. Great buy!

I am so glad my hairdresser recommended my Roku. It has tons of free sports channels from hunting to fishing and everything in between. I also have a les mills on demand membership and I am able to exercise in front of my TV which is a lot bigger than my tablet. Best product I've purchased so far in 2020. My hairdresser kept saying "if you get it and don't like it just send it back". No way I'm keeping my Roku. Set up was a breeze. Note:  You must have internet! Must have an HDMI slot on your TV.

When my 4th Blu-ray player died I decided since the Fire Stick works so well on my second TV I would get another.  Unfortunately they were not in stock so I went with the Roku.  At less than half price of a cheap blu ray but still giving me access to everything I need I think either one, Roku or Firestick are a great item.
Works great. My samsung tv dropped access to a few things so I got this to help out. I can watch sling, disney+, netflix, vudu, Amazon,  and lots more with ease.

It includes everything you need, the adapter, cables, a remote control with batteries in (note: the control is vary basic, no power nor volume buttons), even some cute stickers! I love the design, even the screen saver is very cute. I connected my roku to an old tv that was lying around my house for years, it works great and it was really easy to set up. It cost me less than $30 and now my tiny old tv plays youtube, hulu, netflix, spotify etc etc etc (including non-susbcription channels), which is a win, 'cause I'm a broke college student, it's an amazing investment and it came very quickly! I highly recommend it, especially if you're tight on money and dont wanna pay for dish or direct tv.

I have an Apple TV and a fire stick. We then ended up receiving a older flat screen TV from a friend. The Apple TV is nice but expensive and we wanted to try something different so I bought the roku. Both my wife and I really like the user interface. The unit itself works as well as the the other two devices but it is the user interface that convinced us to buy Roku devices in the future.

I went to set up this device and my computer was taken over by some pop-up that I thought was Roku company but it was not have spent the last three days straightening it all out, they charged me to set up my device and it is supposed to be free!  If Amazon is aware of this, you need to fix it.

I bought this Roku for streaming YouTube TV.  I had no problems for the first 2 1/2 months.  In the last couple of weeks there was an update which causes severe problems with the YouTube Tv app, making it very frustrating if not unusable. It hesitates to start, freezes or goes to a black screen.  Nothing that Roku recommends corrects the problem.  The problem is not the You Tube app because there are no issues using it in my phone or tablet.  If you  intend to use this device specifically for streaming YouTube TV, find a different device.

This little device was a game changer. My cable company took Cinemax out of my package and thought I would pay 20 dollars for it separately. Boy were they wrong. I was able to get Cinemax on Roku for half the price. There is always something to watch and if you subscribe to SiriusXM they have that on the Roku as well. I also have a Hoopla account and even that is on this device. The Roku was a game changer and always gives me something to watch. I can never get bored.

After experiencing serious buffering issues with a LG DVD player and the Fire Stick, I took one more chance on the ROKU Express. Didn't need the 4K. I haven't had a single buffer in a month. Very easy to use. Set up tip: create your account online as it's easier to bypass the credit card information request. You can add that later to make purchases, if needed.

You can’t watch Amazon prime video with this device. Audio is waaaay out of sync. No recommended solution works. Don’t buy this if you want to watch Amazon. It works great with all other channels. Just not Amazon.

New & smaller slimline, sleek design receiver, about 3”x 1.75” which is nice. It has a self stick base to attach it to your tv stand if you wish, so it doesn’t slide around, looks great. Remote is new and updated with easy navigation buttons linking you directly to Netflix, Hulu, Disney+ and Sling. Great price too! Easy hook up, took seconds to do.

When I kept getting a message that my blu-ray would no longer get Netflix, I had to find something that would.  This Roku Express device was the cheapest way to solve that problem and it did just that.  Now I not only still have my Netflix, but I have a large selection of free things to enhance my tv experience.  Can't go wrong with one of these.

very good product, i bought like 4 of this devices, but one it was defective, my daughter told me too late so i couldn't return it.
